Each year includes specific internships, providing students with valuable real-world experience.

The Bachelor’s in Fashion Design is a comprehensive program that equips students with creative and technical skills to succeed in the fashion industry. The curriculum focuses on core fashion design skills, including clothing design, textiles, pattern making, and fashion marketing. Through hands-on projects and collaborations with industry professionals, students gain experience in creating fashion collections, understanding market trends, and developing unique styles and brand identities. The course spans three years and includes workshops, real-world industry projects, and networking opportunities to build strong industry connections. Graduates are prepared for careers in fashion design, brand creation, and various roles in the luxury and retail sectors.

This program provides a comprehensive approach to the global fashion and luxury industries, focusing on key areas such as fashion buying, merchandising, team management, and stock management. The curriculum is designed to meet the sector's demands, it emphasizes the strategic and operational facets of fashion commerce and luxury goods. Graduates of the program are prepared to pursue roles such as marketing manager or web marketing manager, communication manager, social media manager, brand manager, marketing and communication analyst, event manager.

The Bachelor in Animation at LISAA offers a comprehensive three-year program focused on training students in both 2D and 3D animation. It is tailored to provide foundational skills in various animation disciplines and prepares participants for the dynamic and competitive animation industry. The curriculum includes modules in storytelling, character design, animation principles, and post-production techniques such as compositing. Students gain hands-on experience in industry-standard software and techniques. They are prepared to work in animation studios, game design, and multimedia companies across various creative sectors.

This program offers a comprehensive curriculum aimed at students passionate about video game creation. It focuses on training them in key areas of game design, including storytelling, gameplay mechanics, and 2D/3D graphics. The curriculum emphasizes practical, project-based learning, allowing to develop both technical skills and creative thinking. Throughout the program, students work collaboratively on game projects, simulating real-world industry environments. They learn industry-standard software and tools, preparing them for roles such as game designers, level designers, and 3D artists. It also includes modules on user experience (UX) design, project management, and the business aspects of the gaming industry, helping to understand the broader context of video game development and distribution.

This program is designed for individuals aspiring to become artistic directors. It combines creative training with practical experience, allowing to develop skills in various areas, including design, visual communication, and project management. The curriculum focuses on foundational techniques, creative strategies and it emphasizes advanced specialization workshops. Graduates can pursue careers as artistic directors, graphic designers, or visual communication specialists in various sectors, including advertising, fashion, and media.

The Mastère Communication Digitale 4.0 is a specialized two-year graduate program that focuses on the digital communications landscape and includes training in social media management, content creation, and digital marketing strategies. The curriculum aims to keep up with evolving digital trends, it combines both theoretical knowledge and practical skills to ensure students are well-prepared for careers in digital communication and related fields.

This program is tailored to cultivate a deep understanding of both the creative and strategic aspects of fashion communication. Students are trained in visual storytelling and branding, gaining essential skills in areas like public relations, digital communication, and editorial content creation, tailored specifically for the fashion industry. Throughout the program, they learn to create impactful images and messages that resonate with audiences and enhance brand identity. The curriculum integrates practical workshops, allowing participants to work on real-world projects, from campaigns to multimedia content, enhancing their professional portfolios.

page_content.program: Master Fashion Design and Brand Creation
page_content.program_description: This master's degree is a specialized program that prepares students for careers in fashion design and brand creation. Its curriculum focuses on equipping them with a robust understanding of both creative and business aspects within the fashion industry, including brand identity development, marketing, and trend analysis. The courses combine hands-on design projects with in-depth studies on market positioning and brand storytelling, allowing participants to create collections and develop a brand vision aligned with current fashion industry standards. Graduate can pursue roles such as artistic director, brand creator, fashion designer, fashion stylist, brand developer, business unit manager, product manager.

This program combines traditional fashion skills with advanced technological tools, it provides students with skills in 3D design, AI, and augmented reality. The curriculum focuses on developing a unique stylistic identity and a personal collection, blending creativity with advanced digital techniques to meet the demands of modern fashion. Students gain practical experience through projects and collaborations within the fashion industry, providing insights into managing design, conceptualization, and technology. Graduates are prepared for roles in fashion design, fashion tech, and artistic direction, capable of integrating new technologies with classic design methodologies.

This master's-level course offers a comprehensive curriculum designed to prepare students for careers in the dynamic fields of animation and digital media. It combines practical skills with theoretical knowledge, guiding them through advanced techniques in both 2D and 3D animation. They also benefit from exposure to real-world projects and networking opportunities with animation studios, thanks to the school’s industry connections. Graduates take on diverse roles, such as animators, concept artists, and digital modelers, in sectors ranging from film to video games.

The Mastère in Video Games at LISAA is a highly specialized program designed to prepare students for careers in the fast-paced video game industry. It offers a wide-ranging curriculum that covers game design, programming, and production, ensuring that  participants gain both theoretical knowledge and practical skills necessary for success in the industry. They benefit from modern facilities like motion capture studios, sound recording equipment, and advanced computers with professional-grade software, enhancing their technical capabilities.

The Bachelor Développeur Web is structured as a three-year degree aimed at training students in comprehensive web development skills, preparing them for a range of digital and technical roles. It focuses on teaching both front-end and back-end development through hands-on projects, allowing to apply theoretical knowledge in real-world settings. Students gain proficiency in languages like JavaScript, HTML, CSS, and frameworks essential for modern web applications. They also have the opportunity to engage in internships or alternance (work-study) programs, giving them direct exposure to the industry. Graduates have promising career prospects in roles such as web developers, software engineers, and digital project managers.

The Bachelor Data & AI is designed to prepare students for careers in data science and artificial intelligence. It provides a comprehensive understanding of data management, machine learning, programming, and AI applications in modern digital industries. Students gain hands-on experience through real-world projects and internships, collaborating with industry professionals to develop a strong portfolio. The program also includes access to HETIC’s network of tech and business partners, with many graduates securing positions at well-known companies like L'Oréal, Publicis, and Crédit Agricole.

This Bachelor aims to provide students a foundation in web marketing and user-centered design. The curriculum covers essential subjects such as digital marketing strategy, web development basics, UX design principles, SEO, social media management, and analytics. It emphasizes the application of data insights to optimize campaigns, making graduates well-prepared for roles in these fields.

This program is a comprehensive five-year curriculum that prepares students for a career in digital and technological transformation. It emphasizes practical learning through real-world cases and projects in collaboration with partner companies. Students also have opportunities for coaching, digital learning modules, and professional situational training.

The Mastère Data & IA at HETIC is a specialized program designed to equip students with advanced skills in data science and artificial intelligence, focusing on practical application in business contexts. The curriculum emphasizes a strong foundation in data analysis, machine learning, deep learning, and big data technologies, combined with business intelligence and data-driven decision-making skills. Students are also trained to handle the ethical and strategic implications of AI in the industry. The program also combines hands-on projects and theoretical knowledge, ensuring that graduates are well-prepared to enter the workforce as data scientists, AI engineers, or data strategists.

This two-year master's program designed for students aiming to excel in digital marketing and user experience (UX). It combines both practical and theoretical coursework, focusing on essential digital marketing skills like data-driven strategy development, SEO/SEM optimization, social media marketing, and UX/UI design principles. Students learn to interpret and apply UX insights to enhance customer journeys and improve business outcomes. The curriculum also emphasizes data analytics, preparing graduates to create optimized digital marketing campaigns grounded in data analysis. They are prepared for roles such as digital marketing manager, SEO/SEA consultant, UX/UI designer, project manager.

The Bachelor Fashion Designer is a four-year course that is designed for students who wish to develop skills in fashion design, focusing on creating apparel for various sectors including couture, womenswear, menswear, and sportswear. The program is available in both French and English and spans three years, followed by an additional year focused on professionalization. Its curriculum emphasizes creativity, allowing students to develop their personal style while gaining essential technical skills. It includes design techniques, understanding fashion trends, and the overall creative process involved in fashion design. Participants also benefit from a network of industry professionals and partnerships that enhance their learning and job placement opportunities. Graduates pursue roles such as fashion stylist designer, accessories stylist, textile stylist designer, fashion creator, stylist consultant, pattern maker, collection coordinator, and art director.

This Bachelor is designed to equip students with the skills necessary to create and implement communication strategies for fashion brands. It focuses on both traditional communication methods (like press relations and event management) and modern approaches (including social media and digital marketing). The courses include in-depth studies on brand analysis, competitor monitoring, and the effective use of various media. Graduates are prepared to work as communication managers in the fashion industry, responsible for enhancing brand visibility and reputation through a variety of communication channels. They will analyze market trends, devise strategic campaigns, and collaborate with professionals like photographers and event producers.

The Mastère Créateur de Mode is a specialized program designed for aspiring fashion creators. It is focused on developing your skills in fashion design, allowing students to conceptualize and create collections that reflect contemporary fashion trends. The curriculum includes comprehensive training in fashion design techniques, creative processes, and the development of a personal style. Students learn about the fashion industry, including market analysis and the business aspects of running a fashion brand. They also have opportunities to participate in fashion shows and connect with industry professionals. Graduates are well-prepared for various roles , including fashion designer, stylist, and brand manager.

page_content.program: Mastère Manager en Communication de Mode
page_content.program_description: This master’s program is geared toward developing expertise in media and brand communication specific to the fashion industry. Students are trained in strategic communication, digital media, and brand storytelling, with a strong emphasis on practical skills. The curriculum is well-suited for those looking to become specialists in fashion PR, media relations, and digital strategy for brands.

This Bachelor is designed for students interested in pastry arts and entrepreneurship. It provides comprehensive training, focusing not only on the mastery of sweet culinary arts but also on essential business and management skills. The curriculum integrates courses in management, marketing, and communication to prepare students for business ownership or leadership roles within the industry. They also develop proficiency in advanced pastry and confectionery techniques under the guidance of experienced chefs. Graduates from this program are prepared for a range of careers, including roles in pastry management, production unit leadership, or as entrepreneurs running their own culinary ventures.

This program is aimed at developing not only advanced pastry skills but also strong business acumen, combining culinary training with entrepreneurship. The curriculum covers essential techniques in pâtisserie, food business fundamentals, and management, with courses in areas such as marketing, communication, and strategic planning. Students have the option to study in either French or English, with the program including practical training through internships. The goal is to prepare them for leadership roles in the pastry industry, whether as independent entrepreneurs, team managers, or professionals in prestigious establishments like hotels and luxury restaurants.

This bachelor is a three-year program that integrates practical chocolate and confectionery arts with entrepreneurial training. It provides students with the foundational skills to master chocolate-making and confectionery while fostering the entrepreneurial abilities needed to manage or launch a culinary business. The program offers intensive practical training in advanced  techniques, and courses in business management and marketing specifically tailored to the culinary industry. It also includes hands-on experience through partnerships with industry professionals and participants gain insights into real-world operations by working directly in labs and production environments.

This course is designed to equip students with the skills needed to create intuitive and engaging digital experiences. The curriculum covers various aspects of user experience (UX) and user interface (UI) design, integrating management principles to prepare students for leadership roles in the digital design industry. The program places significant emphasis on collaboration with companies, which often provide real briefs for projects. By the final year, students are equipped to enter fields such as design management, digital product development, and creative direction, with a reported 90% employment rate for graduates.

This distinctive program is designed for students who aim to combine technical skills with management and innovation competencies. It spans five years and provides a multidisciplinary approach to digital technology and management, preparing for roles at the intersection of technology, business strategy, and digital innovation. Students progress through a curriculum that blends technical knowledge, managerial training, and project-based learning. The program covers essential areas such as UX/UI design, tech innovation, and digital product management. The final two years are conducted in alternating work-study formats, allowing students to apply classroom knowledge to real-world environments and gain professional experience.

This program aims to develop expertise in digital management, marketing, and strategic innovation. The five-year is structured to bridge the gap between technical skills and strategic thinking. It covers a broad range of subjects, including design thinking, branding, digital project management, SEO, social media, algorithmic understanding, and entrepreneurial strategy. The curriculum is enriched by partnerships with companies that allow students to engage in hands-on projects and real-world challenges across all years of study.

This program is tailored for those interested in combining digital skills with creative product and service innovation. It stands out for its practical focus and digital-centered approach. This two-year program, aimed at individuals with a background in digital, marketing, or management, provides students with in-depth knowledge in areas such as user experience (UX), user interface (UI), design thinking, and digital project management. The course structure also includes project-based learning in collaboration with industry professionals and companies, allowing students to tackle current industry challenges and innovate effectively.

This program focuses on developing expertise in digital product ownership and innovation. It is designed for those aiming to lead digital projects with a strong emphasis on user-centric design and agile methodologies, the curriculum integrates essential skills in project management, business innovation, and digital product development. The course also includes real-world project experiences with corporate partners, where students work in small teams on actual business challenges, allowing them to apply their skills in innovation, problem-solving, and collaboration.

This master's degree is a specialized program designed for those who interested in the intersection of product design, management, and digital innovation. It is particularly aimed at preparing students for leadership roles in product management and innovation within the digital industry. The curriculum covers a range of skills essential to understanding and leading product lifecycle stages, from ideation to market launch, with a strong emphasis on user-centered design and technology integration. It focuses on creating strategies that align with business goals, user needs, and technical capabilities. Graduates of the program can pursue roles such as product manager, chief product officer, and innovation manager, among others.

This Bachelor aims to provide students with the creative and technical skills necessary to develop a career in the fashion industry. It provides foundational education in designing fashion collections, incorporating both traditional and innovative design techniques, and supports students in creating their own distinct styles. The curriculum includes modules in materials and textiles, digital design tools, and various aspects of the fashion production process, including pattern making and garment construction. It also emphasizes the importance of understanding trends, cultural influences, and marketing, helping students bridge the gap between creativity and business essentials in fashion. They are also offered industry exposure through collaborations with established brands, internships, and project-based learning opportunities. This hands-on experience is aimed at providing graduates with a competitive edge in the international fashion industry.

The Bachelor Fashion Styling & Creative Direction at Istituto Marangoni is a comprehensive program provides students with the creative and technical skills needed to excel in fashion styling and direction across various media. The curriculum is designed to enhance their creative vision and refine their abilities in areas like advertising and editorial styling, photographic composition, copywriting, PR, and media planning. It also covers critical aspects of the digital and social media landscape, including content creation for blogs and social platforms. Participants learn to manage production processes in fashion and develop an understanding of garment and accessory heritage. Additionally, a professional design portfolio is cultivated as part of the course, allowing students to showcase their creative journey and industry-ready skills. Graduates are prepared for roles such as fashion stylist, creative director, art director, image consultant, and personal stylist.

This program focuses on advancing students' skills in fashion creativity and technical design. It offers an intensive, hands-on curriculum tailored to the latest industry trends. The courses encompass various areas of fashion design, such as textile innovation, contemporary fashion styles, and the integration of digital tools for design visualization. Through studio-based projects and interactions with fashion professionals, participants gain practical experience in high-demand industry skills.

This one-year postgraduate program aims to deepen expertise in designing and managing luxury accessory collections, particularly emphasizing Italian craftsmanship and style. Participants are immersed in Italy’s renowned luxury sector through exposure to the high standards of Made in Italy quality, and learn to balance creativity with business acumen. The curriculum covers design theory and practical elements, equipping students with advanced skills in collection planning, luxury product branding, and managing production cycles. It also includes the history and evolution of luxury accessories, sustainability in material selection, and contemporary market trends. Furthermore, students gain hands-on experience through industry partnerships, working with accessory brands to create and refine collections under professional guidance. They can take on roles like accessory designer, fashion illustrator, product manager, and collection manager, with skills in luxury branding, visual identity, and market positioning.

page_content.program: Mastère Fashion Styling, Creative Direction & Digital Content
page_content.program_description: This program at Istituto Marangoni in Paris offers students a comprehensive, creative approach to modern fashion communication, combining styling, art direction, and digital media production. It emphasizes the role of visual storytelling in fashion and covers areas like styling techniques, creative and digital content production, and the use of multimedia to enhance brand image. Students engage in a variety of visual disciplines, including photography, video production, and digital design, which allows them to build cohesive content strategies tailored to fashion brands. The curriculum encourages a hands-on approach, enabling participants to work on projects from concept to execution, preparing them for roles in fashion styling, creative direction, and digital content creation in the fashion industry.

The Bachelor in Fashion Business is a comprehensive three-year program focused on merging creative and business skills within the fashion industry. It is designed for individuals who are passionate about both fashion and business, this undergraduate course offers insights into various aspects of the fashion sector, including marketing strategies, brand management, and digital media, aiming to develop well-rounded professionals. Participants engage in hands-on learning through real-world projects, allowing them to gain valuable industry experience and exposure to global fashion trends. The curriculum also places a strong emphasis on digital transformation, providing knowledge in digital marketing and e-commerce—essential skills in today’s fashion marketplace.

This program is tailored to provide in-depth expertise in luxury brand management, especially within the fashion industry. It explores the landscape of luxury goods and services, guiding students through the nuances of branding, marketing, and the global business strategies required in the luxury sector. The curriculum focuses on a range of essential topics: from understanding the creation, promotion, and sale of luxury goods to advanced management techniques for brand strategy and image maintenance. Students gain insights into macroeconomic trends affecting the luxury market, as well as emerging digital innovations. The coursework includes strategic product research, operational efficiency, and brand differentiation through data and AI applications.

This master’s degree focuses on the modern aspects of product selection and buying strategies, integrating business models relevant to today's industry alongside innovative approaches, digital technologies, and media. Students learn the technical and theoretical elements of creating and executing buying campaigns, analyzing various retail formats, macro-trends, and developing market-driven collections. The curriculum emphasizes essential skills like trend forecasting, finance, digital technologies for buying, product innovation, supply chain management, and retail management. Participants work on practical projects, often in collaboration with industry professionals, allowing them to apply the skills they’ve learned to real-world scenarios. Graduates pursue roles such as fashion buyer, visual merchandiser, brand manager, CRM strategist, and logistics and retail director.

page_content.program: Mastère Luxury Hospitality & Customer Experience Management
page_content.program_description: This program prepares students for key roles in the luxury hospitality sector, such as hotel management, restaurant management, marketing, revenue management, and entrepreneurship. The curriculum emphasizes French hospitality's historical impact, fostering skills for strategic management, finance, marketing, and customer experience in high-end environments. It also provides unique access to industry insights through collaborations with luxury brands and practical learning opportunities.

This program is tailored to provide students with the necessary skills to excel in the luxury jewellery sector. It is rooted in the rich history of French jewellery craftsmanship, particularly associated with iconic locations like the Place Vendôme, where renowned brands like Cartier and Van Cleef & Arpels were founded. Students will gain comprehensive knowledge in various domains, including market dynamics, sustainability, and the integration of modern technologies within the jewellery industry. They are well-prepared for roles such as product managers, entrepreneurs, and executives in the luxury jewellery sector.

The Bachelor in International Management (BIM) program at Brest Business School is designed for students interested in pursuing a career in international management. It can be taught entirely in English, making it accessible for international students. The curriculum combines academic rigor with practical experiences in various fields, including international communication, marketing, tourism, geopolitical studies, sports management, and logistics. This broad scope enables students to tailor their education according to their interests and career aspirations. The program focuses on enhancing employability in the international arena by emphasizing linguistic and intercultural skills, preparing graduates for various roles in a globalized economy.

The Master in Management program at BBS is designed to provide students a comprehensive education in management principles and practices, preparing them for leadership roles in various industries. It emphasizes practical learning through innovative projects that integrate economy, science, technology, and culture. Participants benefit from collaborative learning and are encouraged to engage with global experts. The program's connection to local businesses and its emphasis on practical training aim also to enhance employability in a competitive job market​.

The Bachelor in Management program at BSB is a three-year course designed to give students a strong foundation in business and management principles. It focuses on both academic rigor and practical experience, with a curriculum that includes courses in business administration, marketing, finance, and communication. The courses also emphasize skills essential for today’s market, such as critical thinking, problem-solving, and teamwork. The program offers various paths for students to gain international exposure, such as studying abroad or internships. BSB has connections with many prominent companies, allowing them to participate in internships that provide hands-on experience in fields relevant to their studies. The school also offers the option to complete the final year in a work-study format, combining studies with professional work experience.

The Master Grande École program is designed to offer a highly adaptable and internationally oriented education in business management. It provides students with a wide range of specializations and practical learning opportunities. The curriculum is designed to combine academic rigor with professional experiences through internships, international exposure, and specialized tracks. In the first year, students take core management courses to build a strong foundation in essential business topics, such as finance, marketing, and strategy. The program emphasizes real-world applications with options for international exchanges, internships, and immersive projects. Students may also choose to study abroad or undertake dual degrees.

year_2.specialization: Management de la RSE & Développement Durable
All Masters of Science are available
MS en Management des Entreprises Culturelles et Industries Créatives
MS en Commerce International des Vins & Spiritueux

page_content.program_description: The MSc Corporate Finance & Investment Banking BSB aims to provide students with advanced skills in corporate finance and global investment banking. The curriculum covers areas such as corporate finance, financial strategy, mergers and acquisitions, derivatives, risk management, and financial planning. It balances academic rigor with practical experiences, which include seminars, professional insights, and an optional internship, intended to bridge the academic-to-professional transition. The courses are also enhanced through partnerships with financial institutions, providing industry insights and network opportunities. Graduates often pursue careers in roles such as investment banking analyst, portfolio manager, and finance consultant.

This MSc is designed to provide a comprehensive education in the luxury sector, focusing on both foundational knowledge and innovative practices. Students are immersed in the luxury industry's evolving landscape, learning to manage luxury brands while understanding the impact of environmental, social, and technological trends. The curriculum covers core areas, including luxury management foundations, strategic and disruptive management, luxury consumer psychology, and digital project consulting. Participants also explore global marketing strategies, international luxury marketing, and digital negotiation. They are prepared for roles such as brand ambassador, product manager, or consultant in prestigious luxury companies.

This program combines data science expertise with insights into organizational behavior, focusing on how data influences decision-making and behavior across companies. It offers a unique blend of academic learning tied to BSB’s renowned LESSAC research lab (Laboratory for Experimentation in Social Sciences and Behavioural Analysis) and practical, industry-backed experience, sponsored by PwC Luxembourg. Through this, students can engage with Europe’s largest experimental economics platform, gaining access to cutting-edge behavioral research. The curriculum includes essential data science topics like data management, applied information analysis, behavioral decision-making, and practical applications using tools such as Python and R. This comprehensive approach prepares graduates for roles like data analyst, management consultant, and business intelligence specialist in sectors such as finance, consulting, and marketing.

page_content.program: MSc Artificial Intelligence & Digital Strategy Management
page_content.program_description: This program provides essential AI and digital strategy skills for business contexts. It focuses on AI tools, digital transformation, and strategic management. Students explore digital technologies (machine learning, blockchain, IoT), digital transformation, and customer analytics. They also delve into social media engineering, data mining, platform economics, and ethics in tech. Graduates commonly pursue roles like digital manager, AI consultant, and digital marketing manager, with high employability in digital functions.

The MSc in Arts & Cultural Management is designed for students aiming to build a career in the cultural and creative industries. Its curriculum offers in-depth courses covering essential aspects of arts management, such as arts marketing, cultural project engineering, copyright and intellectual property, and strategic management. It includes opportunities for cultural visits, workshops, and expert conferences, enhancing practical skills and industry connections. Graduates can tale on positions like cultural project manager, gallery director, film producer, digital sales manager in music, and marketing manager for cultural institutions.

The MSc in Wine Management trains professionals for the international wine industry. It benefits from a unique location that fosters both cultural immersion and professional networking within the global wine sector. The program covers a comprehensive curriculum blending essential wine business knowledge, such as viticulture, enology, sensory analysis, and tasting skills, with specialized training in marketing, finance, and entrepreneurship relevant to the wine industry. Graduates pursue careers in various sectors of wine management, including production, distribution, and wine tourism.

page_content.program: Mastère Spécialisé® (MS) Management des Entreprises Culturelles et Industries Créatives
page_content.program_description: This program focuses on developing skills for managing cultural and creative enterprises. The curriculum is designed for professionals seeking to deepen their understanding of management within the cultural and creative sectors. It typically combines theoretical knowledge with practical experience through projects and collaborations. Students will engage with topics such as cultural policy, project management in the arts, marketing for cultural organizations, and the economic aspects of cultural industries. They are well-equipped for various roles in cultural management, arts administration, and other creative industries.

This 5-year Program at IPSA provides a robust education focused on aerospace and aeronautical systems, integrating engineering fundamentals with practical applications. It spans two initial preparatory years, which focus on essential sciences and engineering skills. In the third year, students transition into specialization courses in aeronautics, astronautics, and advanced engineering disciplines. T]he final two years (master's level) delve deeper into specific fields like propulsion systems, embedded systems, and aerospace materials, allowing students to hone their expertise. They also participate in hands-on projects and internships, benefiting from IPSA’s partnerships with leading aerospace companies and exposure to real-world industry challenges.

page_content.program: Mastère Spécialisé® (MS) Manager de la Supply Chain
page_content.program_description: This MS is a one-year, fully online program aimed at preparing professionals for high-responsibility roles in logistics and procurement. The curriculum includes topics in purchasing policy, logistics, process management, and team leadership. It prepares students for roles like supply chain manager, logistics platform manager, and international purchasing manager​.

page_content.program: Mastère Spécialisé® (MS) Contrôle de Gestion et Pilotage de la Performance
page_content.program_description: This program is designed to equip professionals with advanced skills in performance management and control. Students learn to design and adapt management control systems, including dashboards that align closely with corporate strategies. The curriculum covers ERP systems and business intelligence, emphasizing the latest technologies in performance assessment and control. Graduates are well-prepared for roles such as management controllers, reporting managers, consultants, or project leaders in information systems.

page_content.program: Mastère Spécialisé® (MS) Gestion Patrimoniale et Financière
page_content.program_description: The Mastère Spécialisé® Gestion Patrimoniale et Financière is a high-level program, designed primarily for those looking to deepen their expertise in wealth and financial management. It focuses on developing the skills necessary to excel in roles such as asset management, corporate finance, and wealth advisory, both independently or within financial institutions.

The Bachelor 1 & 2 in Communication & Publicité at ESP offers a foundational two-year program designed to develop students into skilled generalists in communication. This program provides a strong base in communication theory and advertising practices, integrating practical experiences with academic learning. By the end of the second year, students are expected to have built essential skills in strategic communication, campaign development, and public relations, preparing them for advanced studies or immediate entry into the advertising and communications field. The course also allows participants to explore various industry roles and make informed decisions about potential specializations they may pursue in the third year or in a master's program.
page_content.school: ESP École supérieure de Publicité (Groupe AD Éducation)

metadata.school_name: ESP École supérieure de Publicité (Groupe AD Éducation)

page_content.program: Mastère Spécialisé® (MS) en Commerce International des Vins & Spiritueux
page_content.program_description: This program is designed for those looking to develop expertise in wine and spirits management. The curriculum focuses on technical wine knowledge, advanced sales and marketing skills, and strong managerial abilities. The technical component includes viticulture and wine production, sensory skills for wine tasting. The sales and marketing courses, taught by industry professionals, cover essential topics like marketing, strategy, management, and law with a focus on real-world wine and spirits cases. This MS is also available in both full-time and part-time options, allowing flexibility for students based on location and availability.

This Bachelor is designed for students aiming to deepen their skills in strategic communication and marketing. The curriculum focuses on developing expertise in creating and executing comprehensive marketing strategies, preparing graduates for a broad range of roles in advertising, digital marketing, and brand management. This program includes theoretical foundations in communication strategy, hands-on projects, and industry-aligned practices, ensuring students acquire both creative and analytical competencies crucial for the field.
page_content.school: ESP École supérieure de Publicité (Groupe AD Éducation)

metadata.school_name: ESP École supérieure de Publicité (Groupe AD Éducation)

page_content.program_description: This program focuses on equipping students with essential skills in digital communication, digital marketing, and strategy. The curriculum covers topics such as digital communication strategies, data analysis, social media management, and digital project management, providing a comprehensive foundation for careers in the digital field. As a hands-on program, it incorporates real-world projects, internships, and collaboration with industry professionals, allowing to gain valuable experience and insights into the evolving digital landscape.
page_content.school: ESP École supérieure de Publicité (Groupe AD Éducation)

metadata.school_name: ESP École supérieure de Publicité (Groupe AD Éducation)

page_content.program_description: The Bachelor in Event Management offered by ESP prepares students for careers in the dynamic and evolving field of event planning and management. It is tailored to equip them with both creative and technical skills necessary for organizing memorable and innovative events. ESP offers a network of industry professionals, which provides participants with valuable connections for internships and job opportunities. Moreover, they integrate cutting-edge tools and technologies into their learning process, ensuring that graduates are well-prepared for the demands of the event management industry.
page_content.school: ESP École supérieure de Publicité (Groupe AD Éducation)

metadata.school_name: ESP École supérieure de Publicité (Groupe AD Éducation)

page_content.program_description: The Bachelor in International Marketing and Communicational aims to develop expertise in global marketing and communication strategies. It blends theoretical knowledge with hands-on projects to prepare students for international roles in marketing, communication, and digital strategies. The curriculum Includes English proficiency, public speaking, and legal foundations essential for international communication. It covers modules on international advertising, consumer behavior, brand content, social media, and mobile marketing. Graduates are equipped for roles such as communication project managers, brand managers, and international marketing leads.
page_content.school: ESP École supérieure de Publicité (Groupe AD Éducation)

metadata.school_name: ESP École supérieure de Publicité (Groupe AD Éducation)

page_content.program_description: This course is designed as an intensive, one-year bridging program in communication and marketing, particularly aimed at students from other academic backgrounds. It offers a comprehensive introduction to key marketing and communication principles and skills. The program is organized into six main modules, covering everything from e-learning and soft skills development (such as English coaching and pitch preparation) to in-depth marketing and communication strategy, public relations, digital media planning, and creative project management.
page_content.school: ESP École supérieure de Publicité (Groupe AD Éducation)

metadata.school_name: ESP École supérieure de Publicité (Groupe AD Éducation)

page_content.program: Mastère Marketing de l’entertainment & des industries créatives
page_content.program_description: This program is tailored for individuals interested in the strategic and managerial aspects of creative industries, particularly in sectors like entertainment, digital media, and content creation. It equips students with essential marketing skills required to succeed in dynamic, creative fields, focusing on understanding consumer behavior, managing brand partnerships, and creating effective digital marketing campaigns. The curriculum incorporates a strong focus on industry trends, digital transformation, and innovation, as well as practical, hands-on experience through projects and internships. ESP School emphasizes a professional-oriented approach, helping students build a network with industry professionals and preparing them for roles in marketing management, brand strategy, and media planning within the creative industries.
page_content.school: ESP École supérieure de Publicité (Groupe AD Éducation)

metadata.school_name: ESP École supérieure de Publicité (Groupe AD Éducation)

page_content.program_description: This master's degree offers a comprehensive and practical approach to event communication and marketing in the ever-evolving landscape of digital influence. Students are trained to navigate new technologies and market trends, enabling them to create innovative and memorable experiences for clients. The curriculum is designed to adapt to the demands of the industry, ensuring that participants are equipped to handle contemporary challenges in event management and marketing. Graduates can expect career opportunities in various roles, including: influence marketing strategist, event marketing manager, brand content manager, digital pr specialist.
page_content.school: ESP École supérieure de Publicité (Groupe AD Éducation)

metadata.school_name: ESP École supérieure de Publicité (Groupe AD Éducation)

page_content.program_description: This two-year master's program designed for students interested in building expertise in digital media strategies and brand activation. It focuses on equipping them with the skills to drive brand strategy, execute media plans, and leverage digital technologies to enhance brand presence across platforms. The curriculum combines theoretical coursework with hands-on projects, covering areas such as shopper experience, brand content creation, digital marketing, and the role of brand identity in modern digital environments. Graduates pursue roles like media strategists, brand managers, communication directors, and social media managers, among others.
page_content.school: ESP École supérieure de Publicité (Groupe AD Éducation)

metadata.school_name: ESP École supérieure de Publicité (Groupe AD Éducation)

page_content.program_description: This master’s program is tailored for students who want to advance their skills in creative direction and digital design. It is structured to allow them to gain both theoretical knowledge and hands-on experience through alternating coursework and professional internships. The courses cover foundational topics in creative direction, graphic design, and digital media, while building soft skills such as English and pitching. Workshops and seminars also introduce participants to practical skills like photography, web and UI design, and video production. The second year expands to more advanced concepts, including 3D creation, motion graphics, and the development of digital marketing strategies like transmedia storytelling. It also emphasizes agency management skills, including budgeting, commercial relationship management, and sustainability.
page_content.school: ESP École supérieure de Publicité (Groupe AD Éducation)

metadata.school_name: ESP École supérieure de Publicité (Groupe AD Éducation)

page_content.program: Mastère Stratégie de marque & Brand Content
page_content.program_description: The Mastère Stratégie de marque & Brand Content is designed for those who seeking in-depth expertise in brand strategy, brand content creation, and brand management. The curriculum focuses on skills essential for shaping, positioning, and promoting brand identities across various industries. It includes strategic marketing, branding principles, design thinking, project management, and market analysis. Students also develop practical competencies in areas like team management, strategic vision, and communication across digital and traditional platforms.
page_content.school: ESP École supérieure de Publicité (Groupe AD Éducation)

metadata.school_name: ESP École supérieure de Publicité (Groupe AD Éducation)

page_content.program_description: The Mastère Communication Corporate & Institutionnelle aims to develop communication professionals skilled in corporate and institutional messaging. It focuses on advanced competencies required in the communications sector, such as strategic communication planning, crisis management, and corporate responsibility (RSE) communication. The curriculum includes practical training in soft skills like business English and pitch techniques, specialized courses in managing agency relationships, budgeting, and sensitive communications such as lobbying and crisis handling. Students also learn about public affairs, political communication, and financial communications, essential for those aiming to manage communication within institutions and corporations. Graduates pursue careers as communication managers, PR consultants, and corporate communications advisors.
page_content.school: ESP École supérieure de Publicité (Groupe AD Éducation)

metadata.school_name: ESP École supérieure de Publicité (Groupe AD Éducation)

page_content.program_description: This program is structured for students interested in advanced marketing and communication roles in a global context. It is tailored to provide both theoretical and practical knowledge, emphasizing international marketing strategies and communication tactics relevant to multinational companies and brands. The curriculum covers core topics like consumer behavior, international brand strategy, digital marketing, and market research. Students benefit from direct industry engagement through partnerships with key players in advertising, media, and communication. They can pursue a variety of advanced roles, especially within the international brand sectors.
page_content.school: ESP École supérieure de Publicité (Groupe AD Éducation)

metadata.school_name: ESP École supérieure de Publicité (Groupe AD Éducation)

page_content.program_description: This program is designed to equip students with the skills needed for careers in digital project management. It focuses on teaching digital strategy, project design, and management techniques applicable to the evolving digital environment. Students gain practical experience in areas like web development, content creation, and digital marketing, with an emphasis on real-world projects and hands-on learning. They can work as digital project managers, social media managers, and in other digital roles across various industries.
page_content.school: ESD École Supérieure du Digital (Groupe AD Éducation)

metadata.school_name: ESD École Supérieure du Digital (Groupe AD Éducation)

page_content.program_description: This Bachelor prepares students for a dynamic career in digital marketing. It offers practical skills and hands-on experience in various marketing channels and digital tools. The curriculum is crafted to adapt to the latest marketing and digital trends, incorporating modules on online strategies, social media management, data analysis, SEO, and more. Students also dive into topics on paid search, e-commerce, and performance metrics, with modules often including practical projects or case studies that reinforce theoretical knowledge with real-world application. Graduates often leave with a robust digital portfolio and the know-how to use tools like Google Analytics and social media platforms strategically.
page_content.school: ESD École Supérieure du Digital (Groupe AD Éducation)

metadata.school_name: ESD École Supérieure du Digital (Groupe AD Éducation)

page_content.program_description: This Bachelor is designed to immerse students in digital creation, focusing on essential skills like UI design, video production, motion graphics, and product design. The curriculum also includes innovative projects involving augmented reality and video mapping, culminating in a specialization project, which participants can choose from video creation, creative tech, or UI design. The coursework emphasizes professional skill-building, such as pitching ideas, creating a digital portfolio, and studying relevant aspects of law, alongside practicing professional English. Graduates have access to roles such as web project manager, UI designer, community manager, and digital designer.
page_content.school: ESD École Supérieure du Digital (Groupe AD Éducation)

metadata.school_name: ESD École Supérieure du Digital (Groupe AD Éducation)

page_content.program_description: The Bachelor Développeur Web focuses on developing technical and creative digital skills, setting students on a path to enter the rapidly expanding web development industry. They delve deeper into advanced topics, including SQL development, API development, cybersecurity, and frameworks for mobile and web applications. This skill set prepares graduates to work in diverse roles, such as front-end or back-end development, cybersecurity, or project management within tech companies. The program is also structured around hands-on, project-based learning, enabling them to work on real-world challenges. This approach is complemented by the school’s connections with tech hubs.
page_content.school: ESD École Supérieure du Digital (Groupe AD Éducation)

metadata.school_name: ESD École Supérieure du Digital (Groupe AD Éducation)

page_content.program: Année passerelle chef de projet digital
page_content.program_description: This course is a specialized one-year for students who have completed at least a two-year post-secondary education (Bac+2) and wish to dive into digital project management. The curriculum is designed to equip them with core digital skills, including coding, digital environments, creative software, marketing, and communication strategies. It includes also engage in various real-world projects, such as working in a digital agency setting, UX projects, and cross-disciplinary assignments between ESD and partner institutions.
page_content.school: ESD École Supérieure du Digital (Groupe AD Éducation)

metadata.school_name: ESD École Supérieure du Digital (Groupe AD Éducation)

page_content.program_description: This program is designed for professionals aiming to master the digital business landscape, focusing on digital marketing strategies, e-commerce, and overall digital transformation initiatives. It offers a comprehensive curriculum that emphasizes practical skills, including digital campaign management, data analytics, and online consumer behavior. Graduates often pursue careers as product owner, E-commerce product development manager, traffic marketing and customer, data analyst, UX/UI designer, among others.
page_content.school: ESD École Supérieure du Digital (Groupe AD Éducation)

metadata.school_name: ESD École Supérieure du Digital (Groupe AD Éducation)

page_content.program_description: The Mastère User Experience & Interface is tailored for students who want to gain advanced skills in user experience (UX) and user interface (UI) design. This specialized master’s program focuses on creating intuitive and aesthetically pleasing digital products and services, enhancing usability and user satisfaction. It combines theory with practical application, enabling to develop a deep understanding of human-centered design principles, information architecture, and the psychological aspects of user behavior. Graduates pursue roles such as UX manager, digital project manager in UX design, lead UX, customer journey manager, design consultant.
page_content.school: ESD École Supérieure du Digital (Groupe AD Éducation)

metadata.school_name: ESD École Supérieure du Digital (Groupe AD Éducation)

page_content.program_description: This program provides students with the necessary skills for a career in the audiovisual industry. They will learn foundational techniques in video production, including the use of professional equipment, software applications, lighting, editing, and special effects. Advanced topics like storytelling, creative framing, and post-production are also covered, ensuring that they develop a comprehensive skill set. The course also offers innovative training and significant practical experience. Students work on real projects in collaboration with industry partners, which enhances their creativity and technical skills, while also allowing them to build a robust portfolio.
page_content.school: ESD École Supérieure du Digital (Groupe AD Éducation)

metadata.school_name: ESD École Supérieure du Digital (Groupe AD Éducation)

page_content.program_description: This master's degree is tailored for individuals seeking advanced knowledge in digital design and innovative technologies. Its curriculum is designed to foster a blend of technical skills and creativity, preparing to meet the demands of the rapidly evolving digital landscape. The courses include areas such as user experience (UX) design, user interface (UI) design, interaction design, digital storytelling, and design thinking. Graduates pursue positions like artistic director, graphic designer, creative director, digital designer, web designer, product designer, and creative technologist.
page_content.school: ESD École Supérieure du Digital (Groupe AD Éducation)

metadata.school_name: ESD École Supérieure du Digital (Groupe AD Éducation)

page_content.program_description: The Mastère Data Marketing program focuses on the intersection of data analysis and digital marketing strategies. It aims to train students to manage and analyze data effectively, develop marketing strategies based on data-driven insights, and create digital marketing campaigns that respond to consumer behavior and trends. Graduates pursue roles such as digital project manager, product owner, web marketing manager, UX manager, e-commerce manager, application analyst, and web analyst.
page_content.school: ESD École Supérieure du Digital (Groupe AD Éducation)

metadata.school_name: ESD École Supérieure du Digital (Groupe AD Éducation)

page_content.program: Formation Création & Management pour l’industrie du Parfum
page_content.program_description: This program is designed for students seeking to gain specialized knowledge and skills in the perfume industry. The curriculum integrates theoretical learning with practical application, focusing on the entire lifecycle of perfume creation and management. Participants will acquire competencies that include classifying raw materials according to olfactory families, creating fragrance compositions and evaluating their sensory attributes, and conducting market analyses to understand customer expectations and competitive landscapes. Graduates are prepared to take on roles such as fragrance creators, product managers in the perfume and cosmetic industries, quality control supervisors, and business development managers.
page_content.school: École Supérieure du Parfum & de la Cosmétique (Groupe AD Éducation)

metadata.school_name: École Supérieure du Parfum & de la Cosmétique (Groupe AD Éducation)

page_content.program: Formation Formulation & Management pour l’industrie cosmétique
page_content.program_description: This course is designed for students who wish to become experts in the cosmetic industry. The five-year program focuses on equipping them with the essential skills needed for product formulation and management in cosmetics. They learn how to create innovative and high-quality cosmetic products that appeal to global consumers. The curriculum integrates theoretical knowledge with practical applications, preparing participants for real-world challenges in the industry. Graduates can pursue various roles in the cosmetics sector, including positions as formulators, quality managers, production managers, and marketing professionals.
page_content.school: École Supérieure du Parfum & de la Cosmétique (Groupe AD Éducation)

metadata.school_name: École Supérieure du Parfum & de la Cosmétique (Groupe AD Éducation)

page_content.program_description: This program prepares students to manage and lead cultural projects across diverse settings. It offers a comprehensive curriculum covering aspects such as cultural policy, event management, artistic programming, and financial oversight for cultural organizations. The course is structured to develop both strategic and operational skills, essential for roles like cultural project manager, events coordinator, or cultural institution manager.

This Bachelor is a unique program tailored for those interested in exploring both the historical and professional aspects of the art world. It emphasizes the art market, commercialization practices, and professional environments within the sector. Throughout the course, students are exposed to European and non-European art history, art styles, and the intricate processes involved in art valuation and commercialization. Graduates can pursue roles as art gallery managers, art experts, communication managers, and development officers.

This program is a specialized degree focusing on the luxury sector, delivered entirely in both English or French. It is designed to cultivate international expertise, introduces students to the fundamentals of luxury marketing, communication, and project management. Over three years, they explore diverse luxury domains, including fashion, high jewelry, gastronomy, horology, and design. The school also offers a robust network of industry professionals and partnerships, enhancing job prospects for graduates within six months of program completion.

page_content.program: Mastère communication et marketing des industries culturelles
page_content.program_description: This program provides students with the necessary skills for careers in communication and marketing within the cultural sector. It spans two years and offers a blend of theoretical knowledge and practical experience. Participants are encouraged to gain professional experience while studying, enhancing their employability upon graduation. The curriculum covers various critical areas, including cultural marketing strategies and communication management in cultural contexts. It is designed to develop skills for project management, budgeting, and public relations. Graduates pursue roles such as communication manager, cultural affairs manager, production officer, and cultural mediator.

The Mastère Administration de structures culturelles focuses on providing students with a comprehensive understanding of cultural management and administration. They gain a thorough understanding of the political, legal, financial, and technological aspects of managing cultural organizations. The curriculum is tailored to address current societal and economic issues in the cultural market. Graduates are well-prepared for various roles within cultural institutions, including museums, galleries, cultural festivals, and non-profit organizations.

This master's degree is tailored for those who aspire to work within the art market. It is highly focused on providing students with both the academic and practical knowledge required to excel in careers within art galleries, auction houses, art advisory, and cultural institutions. The curriculum is designed to cover various key aspects of the art market, including art history, market trends, financial valuation, and international art law. It also emphasizes practical skills in art curation, gallery management, and the logistical aspects of handling and promoting artwork in a global context.

The Mastère in Luxury Marketing is an advanced program designed for those aiming to excel in the luxury sector. It offers a unique combination of theoretical knowledge and practical experience, aligning with the professional standards expected in the fields of culture, art, and luxury markets. EAC provides students with access to industry experts, active professionals, and a range of practical case studies, enabling them to understand real-world applications of luxury marketing principles. The program offers a multidisciplinary approach, with courses that include not only luxury brand management and consumer behavior but also the cultural and artistic aspects that drive luxury markets.

This bachelor’s program focuses on the study and expertise of gemstones, including precious and semi-precious stones, diamonds, and colored stones. The curriculum covers various facets of gemology, including identification, evaluation, and certification, equipping students to become experts in the industry. One of the unique aspects of the program is its emphasis on practical, hands-on training. ING has an impressive collection of gemstones and precious metals, allowing participants to interact with and study a wide range of gems firsthand. Through this collection, they learn to identify, grade, and evaluate different stones, developing skills crucial for accurate analysis and appraisal in real-world scenarios.
page_content.school: Institut National de Gemmologie (Groupe AD Éducation)

metadata.school_name: Institut National de Gemmologie (Groupe AD Éducation)

page_content.program_description: This program is a foundational year designed to prepare students for a variety of advanced digital and tech-focused master's programs. The curriculum is tailored to provide a strong base in digital project management, programming, and digital culture, helping participants acquire essential skills in fields like web and mobile development, UX/UI design, and digital strategy. This preparatory course also aims to provide both technical and theoretical knowledge to navigate digital ecosystems. It includes practical workshops and projects that simulate real-world scenarios, fostering hands-on experience crucial for future studies in tech and digital domains.

This Bachelor is a comprehensive three-year program focused on equipping students with skills in creating communication products for various sectors, including businesses, institutions, and individual clients. The first year serves as an introduction, covering foundational skills in art, design, and culture. In the second and third years, students gain more in-depth professional knowledge, building expertise in project development, strategic communication, and graphic design. Real-world experience is integral to the program, with projects and partnerships designed to simulate industry scenarios. Throughout the program, participants also develop technical and creative skills such as analyzing communication needs, defining communication strategies, and staying updated with cultural and technological trends.

The Bachelor in Fashion Design is a three-year program that prepares students for professional roles in fashion design, such as stylists and creators. The curriculum is structured to help them master the full cycle of fashion creation, from initial concept through to the production of clothing and accessories. In the first year, They gain foundational skills in art, design, and cultural knowledge, which are essential to the field. During the second and third years, the focus shifts to practical applications through projects, partnerships, and industry collaborations. Participants learn critical aspects of fashion design, including textile technology, prototyping, chromatic experiments, and digital tools for design. The program also emphasizes professional readiness, with stages such as the analysis of client needs, creation of mood boards, and brand positioning.

This program aims to prepare students for professional roles in spatial design, including interior design, architecture, and public spaces. The first year focuses on building a solid base in design fundamentals, art, culture, and initial technical skills. Over the second and third years, participants refine their project management skills in spatial design, exploring aesthetic, technical, and functional aspects. They engage in hands-on projects, often in collaboration with companies, to understand real-world applications of their designs.

This program provides an extensive education in product design, focusing on the creative and technical skills necessary to bring innovative, sustainable products to life. It is part of Condé’s broader mission to cultivate professionals with robust expertise in arts and applied design, and it aligns with the school’s emphasis on multidisciplinary education across fields like design, animation, illustration, and conservation. The curriculum also offers students hands-on experience in product ideation, prototyping, and material selection, preparing them to address real-world challenges in design and production. Graduates have a wide range of career paths, they can work as product designers, industrial designers, design consultants, among others.

This Bachelor is a comprehensive three-year course designed to provide a deep understanding of narrative illustration, particularly focusing on comic art. The curriculum allow students to delve deeper into various illustration techniques, animation, and graphic design. It emphasizes both creative development and technical skills, preparing them for professional work in visual communication. Graduates can pursue various roles as illustrators, comic artists, or graphic designers, etc.

This three-year program focuses on training specialists in 2D and 3D animation, video game design, and visual effects creation. The curriculum is designed to provide a strong foundation in artistic principles, covering essential topics such as narrative development, storyboarding, universe creation, character design, and game design. Students also have the opportunity to apply their skills in practical projects. They will be capable of creating a short animated film or designing a video game, ensuring that they not only learn theory but also gain hands-on experience that is crucial for their careers.

The Bachelor in Heritage Preservation is designed for students passionate about art and cultural heritage. The courses focus on various specializations such as painting, paper conservation (including drawings and prints), and ceramics and glass (like faience and porcelain). After the first semester, participants can choose their area of focus, which allows them to hone their skills in a specific field, making them more competitive in the job market. The program also emphasizes hands-on learning, providing access to a wide range of tools and facilities for practical training in restoration techniques. Graduates are well-prepared to enter various professions, including roles such as preventive conservation specialists, antique dealers, collection managers, and more.

This Bachelor focuses on building both creative and technical skills in photography and animated imagery. It develops students’ capabilities in visual storytelling, blending theoretical knowledge with practical experience in image-making. The curriculum highlights key areas of study include photographic history, image analysis, and project conception. Students learn essential skills such as studio photography, post-production, and digital workflows. They explore artistic disciplines, including fixed and animated image narration, help them refine their aesthetic and communicative abilities. The program also incorporates internships, providing real-world exposure and enabling participants to apply their skills in professional settings.

This master's degree is designed for students aiming to excel in interior architecture, scenography, and environmental design. It focuses on foundational skills in project management, technical and cultural studies, and artistic direction through collaborative projects. The courses cover technical drawing, scenography techniques, project framework in interior architecture, and emerging technologies like 3D modeling. Students participate in workshops that emphasize sustainable design, brand identity, and immersive design through XR technologies. Graduates are prepared for roles such as interior architect, retail designer, event scenographer, environmental designer, and more.

This two-year master's level program focuses on advanced studies in product, furniture, and service design. It aims to develop students' skills in designing practical, sustainable, and aesthetically pleasing products for various industries. The curriculum covers areas such as design thinking, innovation, 3D modeling, prototyping, and design software, essential for creating and refining design concepts. Students learn how to manage design projects from concept to market, understanding brand alignment and consumer needs. They can work within companies as in-house designers, join research and development teams, or work independently on multidisciplinary design projects.

page_content.program: Mastère Direction artistique en design graphique
page_content.program_description: This program deepens students’ knowledge in theoretical and practical aspects of graphic design, with a focus on visual communication strategies and artistic direction. It covers areas like creative writing, storyboarding, film production, website and newsletter design, and packaging, enabling students to produce fully developed communication campaigns. The curriculum is geared towards students who aim to refine their skills in conceptual and strategic design, making them well-prepared for roles as art directors in various creative sectors.

page_content.program: Mastère Direction artistique de la mode
page_content.program_description: This master's degree is tailored to prepare students for creative leadership roles in the fashion industry. It combines rigorous artistic training with essential technical skills, aiming to develop a strong foundation in both fashion design and strategic brand management. Students focus on building core competencies in brand strategy, cultural analysis, project management, and technical skills like 3D modeling and prototyping. The program emphasizes developing a unique artistic identity, supporting them with workshops and individual projects. The curriculum integrates sustainable fashion principles and advanced technical knowledge, such as pre-industrialization processes. Participants also participate in events and collaborations across design fields, enhancing their adaptability and networking within the fashion sector.

page_content.program: Master in Art Direction for Fashion
page_content.program_description: This Master in Art Direction for Fashion is a two-year program designed to prepare students as versatile fashion designers and art directors, capable of establishing a unique creative identity either for an established brand or their own. The course focuses on critical areas such as trend analysis, innovative material research, and visual communication. Participants gain hands-on experience through collaborative projects and practical training to build skills in brand strategy, production, and sustainable design. Graduates can pursue careers as creative directors, collection managers, stylists, and brand founders.

page_content.program: Mastère Achat et sourcing des produits de la mode
page_content.program_description: This Mastère aims to develop expertise in purchasing and sourcing within the fashion industry. Its curriculum emphasizes the strategic and operational aspects of sourcing, including market analysis, supplier management, negotiation, and logistics. It also focuses on sustainability practices, equipping students with skills to navigate the complexities of ethical sourcing and sustainable fashion. The career opportunities for graduates are diverse and can include roles such as fashion buyer, product development manager, sourcing specialist, and supply chain analyst. As fashion sourcing professionals, they work closely with designers and brands to ensure materials meet quality standards and ethical guidelines, and they help to build supplier relationships and manage logistics to optimize cost efficiency and sustainability.

This program focuses on building advanced skills in animation, both in 2D and 3D formats. It is designed for students aiming to excel in the animation industry, whether in film, video games, advertising, or digital media. The curriculum emphasizes a strong blend of technical expertise, creative development, and professional experience. It includes courses in character design, storytelling, motion graphics, and advanced digital tools, like Maya, Blender, and the Adobe Suite, among others. Throughout the program, students engage in collaborative projects and internships that allow them to work closely with industry professionals and gain hands-on experience.

This program is designed for students seeking to deepen their expertise in illustration and comic art. The curriculum encompasses a wide range of subjects, including graphic design, motion design, and various artistic practices such as drawing, live model studies, and plastic expression. Graduates can pursue various careers such as comic book illustrator, graphic novelist, editorial illustrator, motion designer, art director in publishing.

This advanced degree focuses on the practical and theoretical aspects of conserving and restoring cultural heritage objects. Students will learn to conduct thorough documentary research on art objects, develop treatment protocols for art objects, and evaluate restoration interventions effectively. They also engage in in-depth research in art history, science, and technology to understand and implement restoration techniques on selected works based on their specialization.

page_content.program: Mastère Design en Recherche, innovation et développement
page_content.program_description: This two-year program is designed to bridge the fields of design, research, and innovation. The curriculum aims to cultivate designers who can address contemporary social and ecological challenges, it encourages students to engage in interdisciplinary projects that emphasize sustainability and advanced material innovation. Graduates are prepared for roles such as research and development designer, innovation designer, and project manager.

The Bachelor’s in International Relations and Political Science at HEIP is a three-year program that prepares students for roles in international organizations and political environments. It is structured to offer both foundational knowledge and specialized skills in political science, international law, diplomacy, and global economic systems. Students deepen their understanding of subjects such as European and public international law, comparative political regimes, and cultures worldwide. The program continues to emphasize practical skills, with participants engaging in oral methodology seminars focused on rhetoric and eloquence.

The Bachelor of Arts in Humanities program offers a comprehensive exploration of humanistic disciplines, aiming to develop critical thinking and a profound understanding of social, cultural, and historical contexts. It covers diverse subjects including history, philosophy, literature, and political science, providing students with a foundation in analyzing societal trends and cultural dynamics. The curriculum includes interdisciplinary courses that prepare participants for careers in fields such as international relations, communication, and public policy. The program’s structure is also designed to foster adaptability, analytical skills, and a global perspective—qualities that are essential for navigating today's complex social issues.

page_content.program: MSc Manager des Institutions et des Affaires Publiques
page_content.program_description: This two-year master's program is designed to train professionals who wish to work within public institutions or in roles that interact closely with the public sector.
