It is offered through an apprenticeship or professionalization contract, allowing students to gain practical experience while studying. Students learn how to define and implement digital strategies aligned with organizational goals. The courses cover the management of digital projects, including planning, execution, and monitoring. Graduates can take on positions such as digital project manager, digital communication officer, social media manager, web marketing officer, brand manager, content manager, and traffic manager.

page_content.program: Bachelor chargé·e d’affaires BTP (3ème année en alternance)
page_content.program_description: This program is a one-year, work-study course designed to prepare students for the role of a construction project manager. The curriculum includes technical studies in construction, market analysis in the construction sector, Building Information Modeling (BIM) tools, and collaborative projects on project management. Participants learn to manage a construction project from the initial proposal to project delivery, integrating both technical and commercial aspects. They develop strong managerial skills and handle various stages of client relationships autonomously and professionally. Graduates are equipped to pursue roles such as business manager, technical salesperson, and unit manager.

The Bachelor in Quality, Safety, and Environmental Management is a three-year program designed to equip students with the skills and knowledge necessary to manage and improve quality, safety, and environmental systems within organizations. The curriculum focuses on daily safety management, managing waste treatment, updating environmental analyses, implementing actions related to Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR), conducting internal audits, and participating in problem-solving groups. Graduates are prepared for roles such as quality, safety, and environmental manager, QSE coordinator, sustainability officer, and environmental compliance specialist.

Modern organizations increasingly require HR professionals who understand the technical and operational aspects of businesses, especially in industries such as engineering, manufacturing, and technology. CESI offers a Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, designed to equip students with the skills and knowledge necessary for effective human resource management within organizations. The program covers topics such as employment contracts, disciplinary procedures, time management, and regulatory compliance. Students also gain expertise in payroll processing, handling complex situations, and managing social declarations. Graduates are well-prepared for roles such as HR officers, HR managers, or training coordinators across various sectors, including SMEs, large corporations, and public administrations.

page_content.program: Bachelor responsable qualité sécurité environnement )3ème année en alternance)
page_content.program_description: This third-year program aims to train professionals to assist organizations in achieving their Quality, Safety, and Environmental objectives. The courses focus on daily safety management, waste treatment management, updating environmental analyses, implementing actions related to Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR), conducting internal audits, and participating in problem-solving groups. Graduates are prepared for roles such as Quality, Safety, and Environmental (QSE) manager, QSE coordinator, sustainability officer, and environmental compliance specialist.

page_content.program: Bachelor chargé·e des ressources humaines (3ème année en alternance)
page_content.program_description: The third year of the Bachelor in Human Resources aims to bridge the gap between traditional engineering and management by providing students with specialized skills to manage the human aspects of organizations, especially in technical or industrial contexts. Students will develop competencies in various HR functions, including managing employment contracts and disciplinary procedures, overseeing recruitment and employee integration, and facilitating social dialogue and managing labor relations. Graduates are prepared for roles such as HR officer, HR manager, or training coordinator across various sectors, including SMEs, large corporations, and public administrations.

page_content.program: Bachelor responsable performance industrielle (3ème année en alternance)
page_content.program_description: This program provides students with the skills and knowledge necessary for a successful career in industrial performance management. It is particularly beneficial for those aiming to enhance their expertise in production, logistics, methods, maintenance, and continuous improvement within various industrial sectors. Participants develop transversal management skills and apply descriptive statistics in industrial contexts. They explore the evolution of professions within Industry 4.0 and refine persuasive communication techniques. Graduates are prepared for roles such as industrialization manager, continuous improvement manager, supply chain manager, production manager, and maintenance manager.

page_content.program: Bachelor chargé·e d’affaires industrie (3ème année en alternance)
page_content.program_description: This one-year, work-study course aims to equip students with the skills necessary to manage industrial projects and business development within the industrial sector. Students will be capable of managing projects from client need identification to product delivery, responding to tenders, participating in offer negotiations, and developing the company's commercial activities, including client portfolio management and prospecting. Graduates will be prepared to take on positions such as industrial business engineer, business developer, key account manager, or industrial business consultant.

page_content.program: Bachelor Intelligence Artificielle (IA) dans le domaine de la santé
page_content.program_description: The Bachelor in Artificial Intelligence (AI) in Healthcare aims to equip students with the skills needed to apply AI technologies effectively within the healthcare sector. It provides them with expertise in collecting, analyzing, processing, and protecting medical data. Students learn to deploy sensors for data collection, utilize advanced AI technologies, and develop innovative solutions tailored to the healthcare industry. The third year is dedicated to an apprenticeship, enabling students to gain practical experience in real-world settings such as hospitals, clinics, research laboratories, and companies specializing in healthcare AI development. Graduates can pursue positions such as data scientist, health data analyst, health data project manager, developer of e-health solutions, big data architect for health, and research assistant in artificial intelligence for healthcare.

This Bachelor prepares students for entry into CESI's Grande École engineering program while also providing a certified Level 6 (Bac+3) qualification. The curriculum lays a strong foundation for those aspiring to become engineers in the digital sector. Students acquire the skills to analyze and formalize software requirements within a business context, manage software engineering projects, and ensure the operational maintenance of enterprise software solutions. Graduates can apply for the Master’s Degree in Engineering through admission tests, selecting from three apprenticeship-based tracks: General Engineering, Computer Engineering, or Embedded Systems Engineering.

year_3.specialization: Computer Science Engineer - Data Science and Artificial Intelligence
Ingénieur·e en sciences du numérique - data science et intelligence artificielle
Ingénieur·e en sciences du numérique - systèmes embarqués & IoT cursus
Ingénieur·e en sciences du numérique - systèmes embarqués & IoT
Computer Science Engineer - networks, systems, and cybersecurity
Ingénieur·e en sciences du numérique - réseaux systèmes et cybersécurité

year_4.specialization: Computer Science Engineer - Data Science and Artificial Intelligence
Ingénieur·e en sciences du numérique - data science et intelligence artificielle
Ingénieur·e en sciences du numérique - systèmes embarqués & IoT
Ingénieur·e en sciences du numérique - systèmes embarqués & IoT
Computer Science Engineer - networks, systems, and cybersecurity
Computer Science Engineer - networks, systems, and cybersecurity
Ingénieur·e en sciences du numérique - réseaux systèmes et cybersécurité

page_content.program_description: The ECAM Engineering program is a comprehensive 5-year course culminating in a Master's degree. It aims to provide students with a solid foundation in mechanical and electrical engineering. The program is conducted entirely in English, catering to international students seeking a globally recognized engineering education. The first years focus on fundamental courses, including mathematics, physics, and computer science, establishing a strong base for advanced studies. The later years delve into specialized subjects such as mechanical design, electrical systems, automation, and energy management. Students also engage in practical projects and internships. They can pursue careers in various fields, including research and development engineering, industrialization, design office engineering, production, logistics, maintenance, quality management, purchasing, business management, continuous improvement, HSE coordination, and project management in industries such as construction and agro-industry.

year_3.specialization: Industrial Engineering and Supply Chain Management

page_content.program_description: This Master's level course in Mechanical and Electrical Engineering is designed to meet the high expectations of the industry, services, and consultancy sectors, addressing challenges related to digital and societal transitions, as well as organizational and technological changes. The curriculum provides a solid foundation in engineering sciences, including mechanics, materials science, electricity, and electronics. It also focuses on production processes, industrial project management, and management sciences to understand innovation and value creation in companies. Graduates are equipped to pursue a wide range of careers, including operations manager, project engineer, technical manager, systems analyst, business analyst, and IT manager.

This five-year engineering program offers a comprehensive foundation in cross-disciplinary scientific and technical skills, with a strong emphasis on ethics and international perspectives. It covers key disciplines such as mechanical, electrical, energy, and industrial engineering. Students develop essential project management skills for overseeing complex engineering projects, including analysis, problem-solving, data interpretation, and system design. The curriculum also includes courses on business fundamentals, management, human resources, and entrepreneurship, preparing participants to manage and administer organizations in both the public and private sectors. Graduates of this program are well-equipped to work in diverse industries such as energy, transport, and manufacturing. Their multidisciplinary training enables them to lead teams and manage projects across mechanical, electrical, energy, and industrial engineering domains.

year_5.specialization: Master en Management de l’IAE de Lyon

page_content.program: Bachelor in Culinary Arts and Entrepreneurship
page_content.program_description: This Bachelor combines essential business management skills with technical expertise in French Cuisine or French Pastry. The curriculum is designed to prepare students for leadership roles in the culinary industry, equipping them with the expertise to excel in both kitchen operations and business management. It includes key areas such as culinary fundamentals, administrative and accounting management, marketing, and entrepreneurial finance. It emphasizes a personalized approach, offering access to a career center and training in small groups. The pedagogy is action-based, focusing on learning by doing, and is delivered by a high-level faculty composed of professionals from the culinary world. Graduates are well-prepared for roles such as restaurant manager, catering manager, entrepreneur, product development manager, and culinary consultant.

page_content.program: Bachelor in F&B and Hospitality Management
page_content.program_description: The Bachelor in Food & Beverage and Hospitality Management is a distinguished program that combines managerial skills with technical expertise, preparing students for operational management roles in the international hospitality sector. The curriculum covers all aspects of hospitality management, including food and beverage operations, hotel administration, and luxury brand management. It also emphasizes professional knowledge, in-company learning through internships, and business case studies in an international and intercultural environment. In the third year, students can choose from five specializations and are prepared for roles such as revenue manager, hotel manager, head of reception, restaurant manager, event manager, or food and beverage manager.

year_3.specialization: Luxury Hotel, Resort and Park Management
Luxury Hotel, Resort and Park Management

page_content.program_description: This MSc program aims to equip students with advanced skills and knowledge for leadership roles in the hospitality industry. It emphasizes a comprehensive understanding of hospitality operations, strategic management, and innovation. The curriculum combines theoretical knowledge with practical experience, covering areas such as hospitality management, marketing, finance, and operations. Students participate in internships and industry projects, gaining hands-on experience and networking opportunities within the hospitality sector. They are prepared for roles such as accommodation manager, operations manager, quality manager, marketing manager, restaurant manager, and event manager.

The Bachelor in Business at ESDES is designed for students eager to tackle the challenges of the global business landscape. The first year focuses on foundational management courses, enhanced general culture, and human development training. The second year serves as a pre-specialization phase, guiding participants toward their third-year specialization choices. Students have the flexibility to explore different fields over these two years. They also have the option to undertake their third year internationally at partner institutions. This program is ideal for international students who wish to study business in France. With courses taught entirely in English, it offers a balanced mix of academic and professional experiences, emphasizing international exposure and practical skills.

year_1.specialization: DU Outils juridiques du manager (Double diplôme)

year_3.specialization: Marketing du Luxe et Métiers d’Excellence

page_content.program_description: The Programme Grande École at ESDES is a prestigious 5-year program designed to provide a solid foundation in management while allowing for specialization in various fields. The curriculum emphasizes the development of analytical skills, understanding of the business environment, and proficiency in foreign languages. Students acquire fundamental knowledge in management, economics, and business law. They are also required to undertake internships to gain practical experience and are encouraged to participate in international exchange programs to enhance their global perspective. In the final two years, participants choose a specialization that aligns with their career aspirations. Graduates have diverse career opportunities across various sectors such as commerce and sales, communication and marketing, finance and management accounting, HR, and entrepreneurship.

year_4.specialization: Management Stratégique de la Transition Environnementale

page_content.program_description: The Master in Management is a two-year program taught entirely in English, designed to blend theoretical knowledge with practical experience provided by both academics and industry professionals. It provides students with the skills necessary for effective functioning in specialized business fields. The curriculum combines advanced coursework with case studies, group projects, and a master's thesis. Students choose a specialization that aligns with their career aspirations. They are also required to undertake internships to gain practical experience and are encouraged to participate in international exchange programs to enhance their global perspective. Graduates have diverse career opportunities across various sectors, such as commerce and sales, communication and marketing, finance and management accounting, HR, and entrepreneurship.

This MSc is a 13-month, full-time program designed to prepare students for careers in sustainable financial management, green banking, and ESG analysis. The curriculum, developed with input from financial and fintech experts, provides a comprehensive learning experience through research-led teaching. Students gain the skills to create and market financial products that generate positive social and environmental impacts. They also explore strategies for developing financial services accessible to underserved populations. Graduates pursue roles such as extra-financial analyst, impact investor, private equity investor, impact finance strategy consultant, investment and risk manager, ESG manager, and fintech-based fund manager.

page_content.program: MSc Circular Economy and Sustainable Innovation
page_content.program_description: This program offers an in-depth exploration of the principles, strategies, and practices necessary to create a sustainable and circular economy. It provides comprehensive understanding of the Circular Economy framework and its applications across various sectors. The curriculum covers a wide range of subjects, including sustainable resource management, waste reduction and recycling, eco-design, sustainable supply chains, circular business models, and policy development for a circular economy. Students learn to analyze and evaluate the environmental, social, and economic impacts of different production and consumption patterns. They are prepared to pursue positions like circular economy manager, circular economy & sustainability consultant, environmental specialist in a consulting company, and sustainability specialist in product development.

page_content.program: MSc Sustainable Tourism and Event Management
page_content.program_description: This MSc is a 13-month full-time program tailored for students seeking managerial positions in the tourism and events sectors, emphasizing sustainable and responsible practices. The curriculum focuses on sustainable business models, eco-design in tourism, value chain management, and sustainable event planning. Students participate in two field trips to enhance their learning experience. One of these trips involves a project in Athens, Greece, where students act as consultants for a 5-star hotel chain, providing audits and recommendations on sustainable practices. Graduates can pursue various roles, including destination manager, tourist information manager, sustainability project manager, project leader, regional tourism outreach coordinator, ecotourism travel agent, and responsible event manager.

page_content.program: Bachelor Droit et Pratique des affaires
page_content.program_description: This Bachelor is a comprehensive program designed to provide students with both theoretical knowledge and practical skills in business law. It spans three years, with each year building upon the previous to deepen understanding and expertise. The curriculum enhance general culture and understanding of current legal affairs. Students also develop proficiency in written and oral communication in both French and English. They can pursue careers as business lawyers, corporate legal advisors, legal directors, contract managers, compliance officers, and data protection officers.

page_content.program: Mastère 1 Droit et pratique des affaires (admission : diplôme français)
page_content.program_description: This program combines a fundamental legal education with economic and commercial subjects, along with English language enhancement, to prepare students for international careers. The curriculum offers practical learning through case studies, legal clinics, and interactions with experienced practitioners and renowned academics. Graduates can pursue various roles, including corporate lawyer, business lawyer, chief business officer, contract manager, legal director, or positions in management, development, and other support functions.

page_content.program: Mastère 1 Droit et pratique des affaires (admission parallèle : diplôme étranger)
page_content.program_description: This program combines a fundamental legal education with economic and commercial subjects, along with English language enhancement, to prepare students for international careers. The curriculum offers practical learning through case studies, legal clinics, and interactions with experienced practitioners and renowned academics. Graduates can pursue various roles, including corporate lawyer, business lawyer, chief business officer, contract manager, legal director, or positions in management, development, and other support functions.

page_content.program: Mastère 2 Droit et pratique des affaires (admission : diplôme français)
page_content.program_description: This master's degree provides advanced education in business law, combining theoretical knowledge with practical experience. It includes four specializations designed to offer in-depth expertise in various areas of business law, preparing students for roles such as corporate lawyers, legal advisors, and compliance officers.

page_content.program: Mastère 2 Droit et pratique des affaires (admission parallèle : diplôme étranger)
page_content.program_description: This master's degree provides advanced education in business law, combining theoretical knowledge with practical experience. It includes four specializations designed to offer in-depth expertise in various areas of business law, preparing students for roles such as corporate lawyers, legal advisors, and compliance officers.

page_content.program: LLM in Law and Business (admission: French degree)
page_content.program_description: The LLM in Law and Business program is designed to provide students with a comprehensive understanding of the intersection between law and business. It aims to equip graduates with the skills necessary to navigate the legal and business environments effectively. The curriculum covers areas such as corporate law, finance, international business transactions, data and law, industrial property in the digital age, and strategic management. Graduates are well-prepared for positions such as legal counsel, contract manager, general counsel, legal operation manager, data protection officer, business owner, legal tech lawyer, business lawyer, and banking lawyer.

page_content.program: LLM in Law and Business (admission: international degree)
page_content.program_description: The LLM in Law and Business program is designed to provide students with a comprehensive understanding of the intersection between law and business. It aims to equip graduates with the skills necessary to navigate the legal and business environments effectively. The curriculum covers areas such as corporate law, finance, international business transactions, data and law, industrial property in the digital age, and strategic management. Graduates are well-prepared for positions such as legal counsel, contract manager, general counsel, legal operation manager, data protection officer, business owner, legal tech lawyer, business lawyer, and banking lawyer.

The Bachelor Luxury Business program at Sup de Luxe is a three-year immersive course taught in both French and English, offering students the flexibility to choose their preferred language track. The curriculum covers a comprehensive range of subjects essential for a career in luxury business management, including introduction to management and business administration, development of luxury brands internationally, law of luxury brands, visual merchandising, digital, logistics & supply chain, e-commerce, and Red Carpet conference. Graduates can pursue roles like sales manager, business unit manager, head of SME, marketing manager, digital content coordinator, project manager in web marketing, and promotion manager.

page_content.program: MBA Luxury Brand Marketing & International Management
page_content.program_description: The MBA Luxury Brand Marketing & International Management at Sup de Luxe is designed by industry professionals to prepare students for high-responsibility positions in the luxury sector. Established in 1990, this program has over 32 years of experience in training future luxury managers. It offers a comprehensive curriculum that covers key areas such as general and sectoral luxury culture, fundamentals of luxury marketing and business, luxury brand communication, operations management, trend analysis and creativity, distribution and logistics, digital, and international trade. The program also includes assignments and case studies from luxury companies, allowing students to apply theoretical knowledge in practical settings. Graduates pursue roles like marketing manager, group leader, brand or product manager, head of sector, purchasing manager, event manager, brand director, and distribution manager.

The MSc in Global Luxury Brand Management aims to prepare high-potential profiles for luxury companies internationally, equipping them to assume roles in business development, retail, digital marketing, and more. The curriculum covers various aspects of luxury brand management, including consumer analysis and behavior, product policy and management, brand management, communication and advertising, social networks and digital marketing, luxury retailing and merchandising, market research, and international distribution systems. Graduates can pursue various roles like business development manager, retail manager, digital marketing specialist, brand manager, and merchandising manager.

This MSc is designed for students aiming to specialize and prepare for high-level positions in the dynamic fashion and luxury industries. It offers a comprehensive range of management courses alongside specialized fashion management subjects, all taught by industry professionals. Students are encouraged to demonstrate original creative thinking and autonomy in developing project ideas that address the evolving needs of the fashion industry. They gain insights into business practices and are equipped to engage with emerging technologies pertinent to today's international fashion landscape. Graduates take on positions such as style director or art director, product manager, stylist, collection coordinator, purchasing manager, and press officer.

This program provides the necessary skills for marketing, sales, and distribution in the high-end food and beverage industry, both in France and internationally. It aims to develop a pool of young managers and entrepreneurs for the food, gastronomy, wine, and spirits sectors, as well as the hotel and restaurant industry. Students will understand the global landscape of the luxury industry. The courses include subjects such as entrepreneurial finance and accounting management, supply chain and logistics, introduction to viticulture, food and wine tourism marketing, and international development for food companies. Potential career paths include brand ambassador, product manager, purchasing manager, communication roles (public relations, event management), hotel manager, international business developers, area managers for food or gourmet catering brands, and service manager for a specialist retailer.

This Bachelor is a comprehensive three-year course designed to equip students with essential skills in computer programming and information technology. The curriculum emphasizes both theoretical knowledge and practical experience, preparing graduates for various roles in the IT industry. It covers introduction to programming languages, fundamentals of computer science, mathematics for computing, web development basics, database management, etc. Graduates often pursue roles such as software developer, web developer, mobile application developer, database administrator, IT project manager.

page_content.program: Bachelor IA Marketing Digital et Communication
page_content.program_description: This program provides students with both strategic and operational expertise in digital marketing and communication. The curriculum emphasizes a technological foundation, preparing graduates to adapt to various industries and sectors. It covers a wide range of topics such as brand content, influencer marketing, community management, e-business, data marketing, UX/UI design, SEO/SEA, and Adobe Photoshop/Illustrator. These subjects are designed to provide students with a solid foundation in both the creative and analytical aspects of digital marketing. Graduates can work as internal/external communication officers, multichannel communication graphic designers, community managers, social media and community moderators, media planners, traffic managers, and social media managers.

This Bachelor program offers a comprehensive foundation in cybersecurity, blending theoretical concepts with practical expertise to prepare students for success in this rapidly evolving field. The curriculum spans key areas such as network security, ethical hacking, cryptography, and digital forensics, ensuring a well-rounded education. Through hands-on projects and real-world simulations, students build critical problem-solving abilities and gain valuable experience. Graduates are equipped to pursue diverse career paths, including roles as cybersecurity analysts, penetration testers, infrastructure and cloud administrators, and security administrators. Join this program to become a skilled professional ready to tackle the challenges of modern cybersecurity.

page_content.program: MSc Expert IT – IA - Big Data
page_content.program_description: This master's degree aims to train IT professionals in intelligent applications and big data. It equips students with fundamental and technical skills, preparing them to lead technical teams, manage specialized projects, and address the specific needs of various societal actors. The curriculum spans two years and includes modules on IT project management, development and databases, intelligent applications and big data, professional practice, and English language. Graduates can pursue roles such as IT project manager, big data manager, IT application coordinator, technical architect, functional consultant, and technical consultant.

The MSc IA Marketing & Communication program is tailored to provide advanced skills in artificial intelligence, marketing, and communication. It offers a comprehensive curriculum that covers a range of topics, including digital marketing, communication strategies, and the application of AI in business contexts. Students benefit from a project-based learning approach, allowing them to apply theoretical concepts to real-world scenarios. The program is available in both initial training and alternating formats, catering to students' varying needs. Graduates are prepared for roles such as head of digital marketing, social media manager, marketing project manager, media planning manager, event project manager, digital brand manager, and partnership manager.

The MSc IA Marketing & Business program aims to equip students with advanced skills in artificial intelligence (AI) and its applications in marketing and business. It focuses on integrating AI technologies to enhance marketing strategies, improve business decision-making, and drive innovation. The curriculum combines theoretical knowledge with practical applications. Students will engage in courses covering AI fundamentals, machine learning, data analytics, digital marketing strategies, and business management. Graduates of this MSc are well-prepared for various roles, including AI marketing strategist, data analyst, digital marketing manager, and business consultant.

This master's degree is tailored for individuals aiming to become experts in the in information technology and cybersecurity, focusing on both theoretical knowledge and practical application. The curriculum is structured to cover a wide range of topics, including advanced cybersecurity principles, network security, cryptography, risk management, incident response, ethical hacking, and security governance. Graduates take on positions such as IT project manager, cybersecurity project manager, functional consultant, technical consultant, network and cybersecurity engineer for multi-protocol infrastructures, and project manager for high availability network architectures.

The Bachelor Digital Business Development program at EBS Paris is designed to train middle-managers capable of addressing the challenges of digital transformation in businesses. The curriculum covers various aspects of digital business development, including digital marketing strategies, e-commerce, and the implementation of digital tools to enhance business operations. Graduates pursue roles such as head of sales, head of marketing, head of digital marketing, business developer, marketing & CRM project manager, chief marketing officer, growth hacker, and customer success manager.

EBS Paris offers a comprehensive five-year Grande École Program, culminating in a Master's in Management degree. This program is structured into a three-year Bachelor cycle followed by a two-year Master cycle, providing students with a solid foundation in various management disciplines, including finance, marketing, and strategy. It emphasizes practical application through internships and international exchanges, preparing graduates for leadership roles in the global business arena. The school's commitment to multilingual education ensures that students are proficient in at least three languages, a significant advantage in today's interconnected world.

year_5.specialization: International Hospitality Management (Dual degree x École Ferrières)
Management des risques et éthique des affaires (Double diplôme avec ICP)
IA Marketing & Business (Double diplôme avec École 89)
International Luxury Marketing (Dual degree x École Ferrières)

page_content.program_description: The Master Grande École provides students with essential and advanced management skills, international exposure, and professional specialization, preparing them for leadership roles in the business world. The curriculum offers a blend of theoretical knowledge and practical experience, with a focus on international business expertise and language proficiency. It includes internships and projects with industry partners, and this hands-on approach enhances students' employability while providing them with valuable insights into real-world business operations.

year_1.specialization: International Hospitality Management (Dual degree x École Ferrières)
Management des risques et éthique des affaires (Double diplôme avec ICP)
IA Marketing & Business (Double diplôme avec École 89)
International Luxury Marketing (Dual degree x École Ferrières)

year_2.specialization: International Hospitality Management (Dual degree x École Ferrières)
Management des risques et éthique des affaires (Double diplôme avec ICP)
IA Marketing & Business (Double diplôme avec École 89)
International Luxury Marketing (Dual degree x École Ferrières)

page_content.program_description: This MBA program is designed to equip students with comprehensive knowledge and skills in international finance and business management. It focuses on developing expertise in financial strategies, international markets, and global business operations. The courses combine theoretical learning with practical applications, including case studies, group projects, and internships, allowing students to apply these theoretical concepts to real-world scenarios. Graduates are prepared for roles in the international business arena, such as financial analysts, international business managers, investment bankers, and corporate strategists.

This MBA focuses on international trade, providing a comprehensive understanding of global markets, trade regulations, and cross-cultural management. The curriculum offers a blend of theoretical knowledge and practical application, covering areas such as international marketing, global supply chain management, international finance, and trade law. It is designed to prepare students for the international business operations. Graduates are well-prepared for roles such as international business manager, trade consultant, export manager, and global supply chain director, etc.

page_content.program: MBA spécialisé Marketing Business & Brand Management
page_content.program_description: The MBA Marketing Business and Brand Management is tailored to provide students with an in-depth understanding of marketing principles, concepts, and tools, along with insights into current trends and challenges in the field. It covers various aspects of marketing, including strategic, operational, and digital marketing, ensuring a well-rounded education. The courses are taught by professionals from diverse sectors, offering practical knowledge and real-world applications. Graduates are prepared for roles such as marketing director, brand director, marketing manager, product manager, and marketing consultant.

This program provides a thorough understanding of international business practices, covering areas such as global marketing, international finance, and cross-cultural management. Students benefit from instruction by experienced faculty members who bring a wealth of knowledge and real-world experience to the classroom. This expertise enhances the learning experience and provides valuable insights into current industry trends and challenges. Graduates are well-positioned for careers in multinational corporations, international organizations, and various industries worldwide. The skills and knowledge gained through the program open doors to a wide range of roles such as international business developer, product manager, supply chain manager, international consultant, brand content executive, international finance analyst, and international HR consultant.

page_content.program: Bachelor Sciences et Ingénierie - Manager de la construction
page_content.program_description: The Bachelor of Science and Engineering – Construction Manager program is designed to train mid-level managers in sustainable construction. It addresses the evolving challenges in construction by combining foundational knowledge with hands-on experience and high-quality scientific training. The curriculum provides high-quality scientific education, offering a solid understanding of construction issues and project management. In the third year, students can choose from three major options in high-demand areas within construction: Building/Public Works Project Management, Real Estate Projects, or Smart and Sustainable City.

This Bachelor aims to train future construction managers in both building and public works sectors. The curriculum is structured to provide students with robust technical and scientific knowledge specific to construction project management, along with essential skills in human resources management, safety, quality, and environmental considerations. Participants learn  to plan, organize, and control construction, development, or equipment projects for buildings and infrastructure. Graduates are prepared for roles such as construction site manager, project manager in building construction and renovation, and public works supervisor, overseeing infrastructure projects like urban developments, railways, ports, airports, and green spaces.

The Bachelor in Architecture & Construction program is a three-year course that bridges the disciplines of architecture and construction, providing graduates with flexibility in their career paths. Students learn to analyze the context and contemporary issues related to building a city or structure. They also assist in the reception and finalization of construction sites. Graduates can pursue various roles, including architectural assistant, assistant BIM manager, project supervisor assistant, real estate project manager, and construction supervisor.

The integration of geospatial data is becoming increasingly vital in civil engineering, enabling optimized resource management, informed decision-making, and an enhanced understanding of environmental and technical aspects of projects. This innovative program prepares students to contribute to the development of smart, sustainable, and resilient cities. The curriculum combines geospatial technology with civil engineering to address future challenges in infrastructure development. Students will gain practical and technical skills in geomatics, 3D modeling, and geospatial data analysis, which enhance infrastructure design and management. Graduates can pursue careers in infrastructure project management, urban planning, and environmental risk management—sectors experiencing significant growth.

The Grande École Engineering Program at ESTP is a prestigious engineering course designed to equip students with the skills and knowledge necessary to excel in the fields of construction and sustainable development. Recognized by companies as a benchmark in training construction and sustainable development managers, this program ensures immediate professional integration in France and abroad. The courses include modeling and problem-solving tools, numerical signal processing, BIM, data science, building energy, electricity and energy, eco-design, renovation, business economics, innovation and research, project management, soft skills, foreign languages. Students choose a specialization in innovative and industry-relevant fields. Graduates are prepared for positions such as business engineer, construction economist engineer, BIM manager, nuclear civil engineering engineer, building energy efficiency engineer, industrial engineer, design office engineer, construction project manager, etc.

year_5.specialization: Génie énergétique de la construction durable (GECD)
Production d'énergie, transport et stockage, Smart grid
Rénovation et réhabilitation du patrimoine bâti

page_content.program_description: The Master in Engineering is a high-level engineering degree recognized by companies as a benchmark in the training of construction and sustainable development managers. Focused on the challenges of tomorrow's low-carbon construction, infrastructure, and urban development, the program is built around a core curriculum that consolidates scientific knowledge and a personalized educational pathway for each engineering student. The courses include modeling and problem-solving tools, numerical signal processing, BIM, data science, geomatics, building energy, eco-design, renovation, business economics, project management, soft skills, and foreign languages. Graduates are prepared for positions such as business engineer, construction economist, BIM manager, nuclear civil engineer, building energy efficiency engineer, industrial engineer, design office engineer, construction project manager, and more.

year_2.specialization: Génie énergétique de la construction durable (GECD)
Production d'énergie, transport et stockage, Smart grid
Rénovation et réhabilitation du patrimoine bâti

page_content.program: Mastère Spécialisé® Maîtrise d'ouvrage et gestion immobilière MOGI
page_content.program_description: This specialized master's program is designed to train professionals with comprehensive skills in real estate project management and property management. The curriculum provides the technical, legal, commercial, and financial knowledge necessary to oversee the entire lifecycle of real estate projects, from inception to management. The MS MOGI aims to develop managers capable of ensuring coherence between project development, construction oversight, and the management of real estate assets, including residential, office spaces, and public or private establishments. It addresses emerging industry needs such as Building Information Modeling (BIM) and energy transition. Graduates are prepared for various roles in both public and private sectors, including project developer, business manager, negotiator, program manager, construction engineer, and asset manager.

page_content.program: Mastère Spécialisé® conception intégrée et cycle de vie du bâtiment et des infrastructures BIM
page_content.program_description: This specialized postgraduate program in Integrated Design and Lifecycle of Buildings and Infrastructure addresses the growing demand for Building Information Modeling (BIM) expertise in the construction industry, particularly in response to European directives encouraging or mandating BIM usage for public construction projects. It aims to train individuals to design integrated construction and operation projects for new, existing, or renovated buildings, considering the constraints and models of various stakeholders, especially energy and environmental requirements. Graduates are well-prepared for roles such as BIM manager, project owner, property manager, research engineer, architect, project manager, and construction economist.

page_content.program: Mastère Spécialisé® Responsable Bas Carbone de Projets de Construction RBC
page_content.program_description: This program is designed to equip professionals with the skills necessary to manage low-carbon construction projects, addressing the urgent need for sustainable practices in the building industry. The MS RBC aims to train professionals to oversee all phases of a low-carbon construction project, including new builds and renovations. Graduates will be prepared to deploy action plans aligned with the company's low-carbon strategy, propose solutions to enhance user comfort, optimize construction projects through innovative processes, and manage design projects that address multi-material and multi-criteria requirements. They will take on positions such as developer or low-carbon program manager, low-carbon specialist in architectural firms, low-carbon project manager in engineering consultancies, and low-carbon construction site manager.

page_content.program: Mastère Spécialisé® Maîtrise d'Œuvre en Travaux de Génie Écologique TGE
page_content.program_description: This program aims to train professionals who can bridge the gap between construction and ecological engineering, ensuring that development projects align with ecological functions. Students will learn how to develop a systemic approach to integrating ecological considerations into development projects from the design phase. They will be equipped to enhance ecosystem resilience, improve ecological processes, and preserve biodiversity by incorporating ecological challenges into the primary functions of structures (e.g., transportation, housing) from the outset. Graduates can pursue roles such as ecological engineering project manager, land planning project manager, environmental study manager, urban planning project manager, hydraulic engineering project manager, and project manager in renaturation, fluvial hydraulics, and river restoration.

page_content.program: Mastère Spécialisé® management et techniques en entreprise générale MTEG
page_content.program_description: The MTEG program is designed for professionals aiming to enhance their expertise in managing construction projects. It focuses on the integration of technical knowledge and project management skills, emphasizing sustainable construction practices and the use of digital tools. The curriculum covers methodologies such as environmental certification, Building Information Modeling (BIM), and Lean construction processes. Graduates can pursue roles such as project manager, head of major construction site, technical director of company, works director, technical manager, and head of design office.

page_content.program: Mastère Spécialisé® management de l'immobilier et des services MIS
page_content.program_description: This program prepares professionals for key roles in the rapidly evolving real estate sector, both in public and private domains. The curriculum covers essential aspects such as law, procurement, marketing, accounting, valuation, business planning, finance, energy transition, and management control. A comprehensive real estate master plan is developed to illustrate the interconnections between these domains and professions. Graduates can pursue roles including financial operations coordinator, real estate portfolio manager, property management company manager, program developer, operations manager, user services manager, and head of the design office.

page_content.program: Mastère Spécialisé® management dans les entreprises de construction AMEC
page_content.program_description: The AMEC program is a specialized master's degree designed to train future managers in the construction industry. It prepares young graduates and professionals in career transition to lead construction projects in France and internationally, enabling them to quickly become operational in roles such as project manager, business engineer, or as part of a project team handling complex public or private projects. The courses cover various aspects of construction and management, including strategy, commercial approaches, project planning, risk management, Building Information Modeling (BIM), environmental impact, safety, finance, human resources, and legal considerations. Graduates are equipped to assume roles such as project manager, business engineer, sales director, profit center manager, strategic operations consultant, program director, or company executive within the construction industry.

The Bachelor in Biotechnologies program at Sup'Biotech is a comprehensive three-year program designed to prepare students for diverse middle management roles by providing a solid foundation in life sciences, fundamental sciences, and project management. Over the three-year curriculum, with the final year combining coursework and work placements, students develop skills that can lead to positions such as project manager, engineering assistant, or mission leader. Upon graduation, students are fully equipped to take on greater responsibilities and thrive in the fast-paced, innovative, and technical field of Biotechnology.

This innovative five-year program is divided into two parts, in accordance with European standards: the preparatory cycle (2 years) and the engineering cycle (3 years). The initial phase focuses on foundational academic courses, combining science and engineering coursework with management skills and industry-specific technical knowledge. It includes lectures, practical laboratory work, and projects. Students have the option to study in either French or English during this cycle. In the advanced phase, participants choose a major and are prepared for dynamic careers in various sectors, including health and pharmaceuticals, food-processing innovation, cosmetics, bioinformatics, and environmental sciences. Most courses in this cycle are taught in English, reflecting the school's commitment to internationalization. Additionally, students are required to complete internships, which provide them with real-world experience in the biotechnology industry.

The Bachelor in Management program at ISTEC is a comprehensive three-year professional training course designed to equip students with essential skills in marketing, entrepreneurship, corporate communication, and omni-channel customer relations, preparing them for the dynamic professional world. The curriculum emphasizes practical experience, offering work-study opportunities that allow students to gain professional exposure alongside their academic studies. This approach ensures that graduates are well-prepared for roles in local management or cross-functional project management. For those interested in international business, the International Business major is taught entirely in English and focuses on commercial management in international and multicultural contexts, addressing the challenges of global trade. Graduates often pursue diverse roles such as international business managers, cross-cultural consultants, or global trade specialists.

year_3.specialization: Digital IA et Data Analysis (Istec x EEMI École du web)

page_content.program_description: The Grande École Program at ISTEC is a prestigious course of study that leads to a Master's degree, designed to equip students with the necessary skills and knowledge for successful careers in business and management. The Bachelor's cycle focuses on foundational courses in management, economics, and business law, providing a solid understanding of the business environment. The Master’s cycle allows students to specialize in areas such as digital marketing, international business, or supply chain management, culminating in a thesis or capstone project. Throughout the program, ISTEC emphasizes practical learning through internships, company projects, and workshops led by industry professionals. The program also provides significant international exposure through opportunities to study abroad for several semesters and courses taught in English.

year_4.specialization: Marketing et management de la santé
Business intelligence, IA et réalité augmentée

year_5.specialization: Management de la supply chain (double diplôme avec ENIM)
Marketing et management de la santé
Business intelligence, IA et réalité augmentée
Immobilier ( ESPI) - Évaluation et finance immobilière
Immobilier ( ESPI) - Aménagement et promotion immobilière

page_content.program_description: This Bachelor is a four-year program offered by CY Tech, fully taught in English. It combines rigorous academic training in data science with the Design Thinking methodology provided by the CY School of Design. Students acquire foundational knowledge in mathematics, computer science, physics, economics, and humanities. The curriculum highlights programming languages such as Python and Java, as well as statistics and data management. Graduates are equipped for roles such as data scientist, data analyst, data architect, business intelligence developer, and security manager across various sectors.

The Programme Grande École at CY Tech is a comprehensive five-year engineering program that combines a two-year pre-engineering cycle with a three-year engineering curriculum. This structure allows students to tailor their educational journeys according to their individual profiles and career aspirations. The initial two years constitute the pre-engineering cycle, featuring a common core curriculum in which 80% of the coursework is shared among all students. This foundational period prepares students to select their specific orientation. The subsequent three years comprise the engineering program, which is accredited by the Commission des Titres d'Ingénieur (CTI). During this phase, students can specialize in one area among 20 specializations.

page_content.program: Mastère Spécialisé® Cybersécurité et Smart Systems
page_content.program_description: This master's degree is designed to train future IT managers in the multidisciplinary engineering fields of the Internet of Things (IoT) and communication systems. The program emphasizes evaluating, managing, and optimizing an organization's IT security, covering aspects like privacy, reliability, safety, and legal considerations at both technical (networks, software, data, systems) and organizational levels. Graduates can pursue roles such as security engineer, architect and developer of new technology applications, research and development engineer, project manager, expert in information systems security, security developer, security architect, and crisis management specialist.

page_content.program: Mastère Spécialisé® Management Entreprise Ressource Planning
page_content.program_description: The Mastère Spécialisé® in ERP Management at CY Tech is designed to train high-level executives in deploying ERP solutions. The program focuses on providing knowledge of various business functions and mastery of ERPs. Students develop robust project management abilities essential for coordinating ERP deployments. Graduates can pursue roles such as ERP functional consultant, ERP project manager, head of system applications, and manager services director.

The Master in Management (MiM) program at PSB is a comprehensive graduate-level course designed to equip students with essential management skills and specialized knowledge. The program offers three specializations taught exclusively in English. It is accredited by prestigious organizations and emphasizes practical experience through partnerships with leading companies, providing students with opportunities for internships and real-world projects. This approach ensures that graduates are well-prepared to meet the demands of the business world. Additionally, PSB's international environment, featuring a diverse student body and faculty, enriches the learning experience by offering global perspectives on business and management.

This engineering program lasts two years, enabling future trainee engineers to attain the cultural competencies required for an engineer in Biotechnology from the Sup'Biotech Institute. The curriculum offers a multidisciplinary balance between science and engineering coursework (lectures, practical laboratory work, and projects), management skills, and industrial expertise. Students choose a specialization track and undertake a six-month internship. The program is accredited by Medicen Paris Région and Industries and Agro-Resources (I.A.R.). The school maintains close ties to both the scientific research community and the corporate world and has established partnerships with universities globally. Graduates quickly access senior positions in France and abroad in fields such as health and pharmaceuticals, food-processing innovation, cosmetics, bioinformatics, and the environment.

The Programme Grande École at JUNIA HEI is a comprehensive five-year engineering curriculum designed to train versatile engineers capable of managing large-scale projects and leading teams in diverse technical contexts. The program is structured into the Preparatory Cycle (Years 1–2) and the Engineering Cycle (Years 3–5). The integrated preparatory program follows the official curricula of French scientific preparatory classes (MPSI and PCSI), covering subjects such as mathematics, physics, chemistry, engineering sciences, computer science, languages, and humanities. In the third year, students undergo a transition phase with a common core curriculum that includes courses in fluid mechanics, electrical engineering, chemistry, structural mechanics, and computer science. In the fourth and fifth years, students specialize by choosing a major from various engineering fields. Additionally, they participate in internships or work-study programs, depending on their chosen path.

year_4.specialization: Technologie Innovation et Management International Textiles
Management des Opérations Industrielles et Logistiques

page_content.program_description: JUNIA HEI's Engineering program provides students with a strong foundation in sciences, techniques, and technologies. These subjects are delivered through lectures and tutorials, with knowledge further enhanced through projects and group work. The curriculum features a common core of courses that cover topics such as fluid mechanics, electrical engineering, chemistry, structural mechanics, algorithms, and databases. Students can also choose a specialization from various fields of engineering, including Civil Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Information Technology, Management Trade & Consumer, Smart Cities, and more. These specializations enable them to tailor their education to align with their career aspirations.

year_1.specialization: Technologie Innovation et Management International Textiles
Management des Opérations Industrielles et Logistiques

page_content.program_description: The Master of Science in Smart and Resilient Cities at JUNIA HEI is a two-year program designed to equip students with the skills necessary to develop urban areas that integrate energy efficiency, new technologies, and environmental planning. The curriculum combines architecture and engineering, emphasizing a holistic approach to urban project design that considers both technological and social parameters. The courses include subjects such as innovation & the city, green building & new spaces, environmental urban design, smart & sustainable mobility, smart energy, and connected city. graduates can pursue roles such as innovation and change manager, urban planning manager for eco-districts, or project development manager in sustainable urbanism and architecture.

The Programme Grande École offered by JUNIA ISEN is a prestigious five-year engineering curriculum that integrates preparatory classes with advanced engineering studies. Students begin with a two-year in-house preparatory course, focusing on foundational subjects in mathematics, physics, and computer science. This preparatory phase is followed by a three-year engineering cycle, during which they can choose from various specialized professional majors. This structure allows students to explore their academic interests and career aspirations while acquiring scientific knowledge and practical experience. The program also emphasizes international exposure, providing opportunities for students to spend time abroad during their studies.

The ISEN Engineering Cycle is a comprehensive engineering program that equips students with a solid scientific background and mastery of digital technology. Participants select a specialization from various options, including cybersecurity, artificial intelligence, big data, e-health, mobile robotics, and embedded systems. They also engage in project-based learning, internships, and work-study to apply their knowledge in real-world settings. The program emphasizes international mobility, offering opportunities for study abroad and double degrees with partner universities. Graduates are well-prepared for various roles, such as engineering consultant, junior automation engineer, renewable energy engineer, computer engineer, project engineer, and more.

The Master of Science and Engineering in Microelectronics and Nanotechnologies at JUNIA ISEN is an internationally accredited program designed to equip students with the skills and knowledge necessary for careers in the health, science, technology, and environmental sectors. The course aims to develop students into proficient technicians skilled in laboratory techniques, modeling and simulation software, and computer programming. Additionally, it emphasizes the importance of effective communication and team management. Graduates can pursue various career paths, including the electronics industry, materials science, automotive and aerospace industries, biotechnology and pharmaceuticals, and the energy sector.

page_content.program: MSc Software engineering and information systems
page_content.program_description: JUNIA's Software Engineering and Information Systems program trains engineers who specialize in cutting-edge technologies such as Big Data and Cloud Computing, with a comprehensive approach to design. The courses include Network & System Basics, Python Scripting, Java, Operating Systems, Cloud Computing & Architecture, and Artificial Intelligence. Graduates of this program are prepared for roles such as application designer, website developer, IT solutions integrator, test engineer, systems and network architect, IT project leader, director of information systems, facilities engineer, network operations engineer, web architect, multimedia developer, and more.

This MSc aims to train engineers proficient in both the hardware and software aspects of advanced systems that enhance our daily lives. It focuses on the design, development, and optimization of embedded systems, which are integral to various high-tech applications. Students will gain expertise in creating systems that are efficient, reliable, and tailored to specific technological needs. The curriculum includes foundational courses in electronics, programming, and system design, providing a solid base for understanding embedded systems. Graduates are well-prepared for careers in various sectors, including automotive, telecommunications, consumer electronics, and aerospace, where embedded systems play a crucial role.

This Master of Science program is designed to equip students with the essential skills and knowledge needed to thrive in the field of big data. The curriculum covers key areas such as data analysis, machine learning, and data visualization. It combines theoretical foundations with hands-on experience, preparing graduates for careers in data science and related fields, including data scientist, data analyst, machine learning engineer, big data engineer, and business intelligence analyst.

The Master of Science and Engineering in Biomedical and Health Informatics is designed to train engineers and project leaders specializing in health application/web development, health data management, and biological and medical data analysis. The curriculum covers introduction to digital health, artificial intelligence, internet of things, bioinformatics, biology and bioethics, database, advanced machine learning, and more. Graduates are equipped to pursue careers in various roles within the health and well-being sector, including health data engineer, bio-statistician, engineer in health applications development, and digital health project manager.

The Stop Motion Program at MoPa is a comprehensive three-year curriculum designed to train professionals in stop motion animation, covering the entire filmmaking process from pre-production to post-production. It serves as a transition after high school, helping students confirm their career paths. The courses focus on teaching various techniques—drawing, photography, modeling—and their application in film pre-production. Students strengthen their artistic and pre-production skills by working on storyboards, concept art, character design, and more. They gain hands-on experience in managing a film set and mastering modern tools, such as 3D printing. Graduates can pursue various roles, including director, screenwriter, storyboard artist, art director, character designer, animator, camera operator, editor, and visual effects artist.
page_content.school: MoPA École Internationale du Cinéma d'Animation

metadata.school_name: MoPA École Internationale du Cinéma d'Animation

page_content.program_description: This program is designed for students interested in pursuing careers in the video game industry. The curriculum offers a comprehensive education in both the artistic and technical aspects of game design and development. It aims to equip students with the skills and knowledge needed to create engaging and innovative video games.
page_content.school: BRASSART École des Métiers de la Création

metadata.school_name: BRASSART École des Métiers de la Création

page_content.program: MBA Ingénierie Culturelle & Management (Double diplôme par ICART)
page_content.program_description: This specialized MBA is an advanced graduate program designed for professionals seeking to deepen their expertise in cultural engineering and management. It focuses on equipping students with the skills and knowledge needed to excel in high-level roles within the cultural and art sectors. The curriculum covers the planning, development, and management of cultural projects and institutions. Students learn to design and implement cultural programs and initiatives that align with strategic goals.
page_content.school: EFAP École des nouveau métiers de la communication

metadata.school_name: EFAP École des nouveau métiers de la communication

page_content.program: MBA International Art Market (Dual degree by ICART)
page_content.program_description: This program focuses on the international dimensions of the art world, including art investment, market trends, and cross-border art transactions. The curriculum includes global art market analysis, art valuation and investment, international art law and regulation, cross-cultural management, strategic marketing and sales. Students have opportunities to work on projects involving international art fairs, exhibitions, or cross-border art transactions.
page_content.school: EFAP École des nouveau métiers de la communication

metadata.school_name: EFAP École des nouveau métiers de la communication

page_content.program: MBA Spécialisé Music Business (Double diplôme par ICART)
page_content.program_description: This specialized MBA focuses on various aspects of the music business, from artist management to music marketing and industry operations. It is taught by a team of experienced professionals and academics with extensive backgrounds in the music industry. Faculty members bring practical insights and industry expertise to the classroom. Graduates are prepared for various roles within the music industry, including: artist managers, music marketers and event coordinators.
page_content.school: EFAP École des nouveau métiers de la communication

metadata.school_name: EFAP École des nouveau métiers de la communication

page_content.program_description: The Programme Grande École at JUNIA ISA is a comprehensive Master of Science and Engineering program specializing in agricultural sciences, food science, environmental science, and agricultural economics. It spans five years and integrates preparatory coursework with advanced engineering studies. Students can tailor their education by choosing from various specializations, including Agribusiness and Marketing, Food Science, Environmental Science, and more. The curriculum emphasizes a blend of theoretical knowledge and practical experience through hands-on learning, research opportunities, and international exposure. Graduates are well-equipped for diverse careers in sectors such as agriculture, the food industry, environmental management, and agribusiness, benefiting from JUNIA ISA's strong industry partnerships and career services.

year_5.specialization: Management de la performance environnementale globale

page_content.program_description: This master's degree is designed to equip students with the necessary skills and knowledge to address contemporary challenges in various fields of science and engineering. It provides a well-rounded education with personalized support and a wide range of specialization options, such as agriculture, food science, and environmental engineering. The curriculum includes internships and projects in collaboration with industry partners, facilitating substantial networking opportunities. Graduates are well-prepared for a variety of roles, such as agri-food engineer, agronomist, environmental engineer, financial engineer, and more.

year_2.specialization: Management de la performance environnementale globale

page_content.program_description: This program is a two-year integrated preparatory course designed to provide students with a solid scientific foundation for direct entry into the engineering cycle at ISA. The program offers courses in mathematics, physics, and chemistry to build a strong scientific base. It focuses on life sciences and is accessible to students immediately after they obtain their baccalaureate.

page_content.program: MSc Environmental Science and Pollution Management
page_content.program_description: The Environmental Science and Pollution Management program at JUNIA emphasizes core topics including environmental pollution, remediation methods, water resource management and treatment, as well as soil science and contamination analysis. Delivered entirely in English for over a decade, the program draws on JUNIA's extensive academic and research expertise in sustainable environmental management. Students also gain practical experience through internships in companies or research institutes, enabling them to engage with real-world challenges and enhance their competitiveness in the job market. Graduates can pursue various roles, including environmental scientist, environmental project manager, site remediation engineer, QHSE manager, and sustainability officer.

page_content.program: MSc Smart farming and sustainable agriculture
page_content.program_description: The Master of Science and Engineering in Smart Farming and Sustainable Agriculture at JUNIA ISA is a two-year program designed to provide students with a comprehensive understanding of agricultural science. The program offers a broad overview of agricultural science, covering topics such as food chain theory, crop management, livestock, and plant production. It integrates technical and scientific aspects with economic and ethical considerations to address sustainability in agriculture. Graduates are equipped with strong technical and managerial skills, preparing them for the professional world. They have a wide range of career opportunities, including roles as agronomists, greenhouse managers, soil conservationists, agricultural economists, and sustainable agriculture consultants.

page_content.program: MSc Innovation and management in the food industry
page_content.program_description: The Master of Science and Engineering in Innovation and Management in the Food Industry at JUNIA ISA is an internationally accredited program designed to prepare students for careers in the agrofood sector. Offered in English or French, the program provides specializations in Sustainable Management of Food Production and Quality Management Systems in the Agrofood Industry. The curriculum blends theoretical knowledge with practical skills, covering topics such as quality management, biochemistry, microbiology, production management, and sensory evaluation. Students participate in project-based learning, group work, case studies, and industrial projects in collaboration with partner companies. Graduates are equipped for roles in production, supply chain, R&D, sales and marketing, management, quality and safety, and product development.

year_2.specialization: Research and Development - Nutrition and Health
Développement de Produits Durables - Nutrition et Santé

page_content.program_description: The International Preparatory Cycle at JUNIA is a two-year undergraduate program taught entirely in English, designed for students with a high school diploma (Baccalaureate) or an equivalent. It provides students with a solid foundation in engineering principles, opportunities for international study, and a pathway to various specialized engineering programs. The curriculum includes scientific subjects such as mathematics, physics, and computer science, as well as humanities and project management.

The International Preparatory Cycle at JUNIA is a two-year undergraduate program taught entirely in English, designed for students with a high school diploma (Baccalaureate) or an equivalent. It provides students with a solid foundation in engineering principles, opportunities for international study, and a pathway to various specialized engineering programs. The curriculum includes scientific subjects such as mathematics, physics, and computer science, as well as humanities and project management.

This preparatory program offered by JUNIA ISEN is designed to provide students with a solid foundation in scientific disciplines and an introduction to digital technologies. It is particularly suitable for students who have a strong interest in science but have not yet determined their specific professional aspirations. The courses focus on core subjects such as mathematics, physics, and engineering sciences. They are delivered in small classes and serve as a pathway to integration into the engineering programs.

This program is designed to provide students with a solid foundation in scientific subjects, preparing them for direct entry into the JUNIA HEI engineering cycle, which is accredited by the Commission des Titres d'Ingénieur (CTI) and leads to an engineering diploma. The preparatory cycle is associated with the La Salle Lille high school and follows the curriculum of the classes préparatoires aux grandes écoles (CPGE) MPSI (Mathematics, Physics, and Engineering Sciences) and PCSI (Physics, Chemistry, and Engineering Sciences). This structure ensures that students receive a comprehensive education in fundamental scientific disciplines, laying the groundwork for advanced engineering studies.

This specialized preparatory program is tailored for students passionate about computer science and networks. It offers a comprehensive curriculum that combines essential scientific foundations with early exposure to digital technologies. The curriculum covers a wide range of subjects, including mathematics, algorithms, data analysis, engineering sciences, web development, and computer systems. In addition to these technical subjects, the program emphasizes general culture, humanities, and foreign languages, particularly English. Students engage in both individual and group projects to gain practical experience in the field of computer engineering.

The Cycle Prépa Adimaker is a two-year generalist preparatory program offered by JUNIA. Designed as an alternative to traditional scientific preparatory classes, it provides a practical foundation for students aiming to pursue engineering studies. Upon completion, students can directly enter the engineering cycles at JUNIA's HEI or ISEN programs. The curriculum covers scientific foundations as well as subjects such as communication, creativity, and project management. It includes concrete projects that deepen the understanding of these subjects and incorporates two company internships to provide real-world exposure.

The Cycle Prépa Adimaker is a two-year generalist preparatory program offered by JUNIA. Designed as an alternative to traditional scientific preparatory classes, it provides a practical foundation for students aiming to pursue engineering studies. Upon completion, students can directly enter the engineering cycles at JUNIA's HEI or ISEN programs. The curriculum covers scientific foundations as well as subjects such as communication, creativity, and project management. It includes concrete projects that deepen the understanding of these subjects and incorporates two company internships to provide real-world exposure.

The International Master in Business & Data at Albert School is a full-time program designed to integrate business knowledge with advanced data analytics. The curriculum provides a rigorous education that combines business acumen with proficiency in data analytics, preparing students to navigate and excel in today's dynamic business landscape, where data is essential for informed decision-making. It covers key areas such as business fundamentals, operations and supply chain, financial modeling, digital marketing operations, machine learning, cloud computing, AI for product development, and project management. Graduates are well-prepared for roles such as operations manager, business strategist, or data-driven entrepreneur.
